original: gal te dngos po med pa dang po la ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan dngos po med pa gnyis pa ma brtags na de'i tshe dngos po dang po la dngos po de'i bdag nyid kyis khyab par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te dngos po med pa dang po la ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan dngos po med pa gnyis pa ma brtags na de'i tshe dngos po dang po la dngos po de'i bdag nyid kyis khyab par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the reason for the cessation of the first non-entity is not examined, then at that time the first entity would be pervaded by that entity.

original: de'i phyir dngos po med pa dang po'i dbus su gnas na nges par dngos po med pa gzhan gyi bar na gnas par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po med pa dang po'i dbus su gnas na nges par dngos po med pa gzhan gyi bar na gnas par 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, if it abides in the middle of the first non-entity, it would definitely abide in the middle of another non-entity.

original: de lta na yang dngos po med pa gzhan gyi yang dbus na gnas par 'gyur bas thug pa med do //
analyzed: de lta na yang dngos po med pa gzhan gyi yang dbus na gnas par 'gyur bas thug pa med do //
translated: Even so, since it would also abide in the middle of another non-entity, there would be an infinite regress.

original: 'on te yang rang gi ngo bo kho nas dngos po dngos po med pa'i dbus su gnas pa yin pa des na thug pa med pa ma yin no snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te yang rang gi ngo bo kho nas dngos po dngos po med pa'i dbus su gnas pa yin pa des na thug pa med pa ma yin no snyam na /
translated: But if you think that the entity itself abides in the middle of the non-entity, then there is no infinite regress.

original: don de zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don de zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning is that it would be like that.

original: dngos po med pa gzhan la gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos po med pa gzhan la gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It would abide in another non-entity. This is the meaning.

original: de lta yin dang thug pa med pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de lta yin dang thug pa med pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: If that were so, there would be an infinite regress. This is what is said.

original: gang zhig gnas na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhig gnas na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Where would it abide?

original: bum pa dang snam bu dag gi bar na gnas pa'i sa phyogs gang yin pa de ni bum pa'i gzhi yin la /
analyzed: bum pa dang snam bu dag gi bar na gnas pa'i sa phyogs gang yin pa de ni bum pa'i gzhi yin la /
translated: Whatever is the place between the pot and the cloth is the basis of the pot.

original: gzhi de las tha dad pa'i dngos po med pa gang yin pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhi de las tha dad pa'i dngos po med pa gang yin pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: And that which is the non-existence of a thing different from that basis is the non-existence of the cloth.

original: dper na snam bu'i zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dper na snam bu'i zhes bya ba ni /
translated: For example, the cloth

original: shing dang bum pa dag gi bar na gnas pa'i snam bu'o //
analyzed: shing dang bum pa dag gi bar na gnas pa'i snam bu'o //
translated: is the cloth that is between the tree and the pot.

original: phyogs kyi chos brjod pa ni /
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos brjod pa ni /
translated: The expression of the property of the subject is

original: dngos po med pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúthe non-existence of the cloth.‚Äù

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rtsod pa'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rtsod pa'o //
translated: The argument is ‚ÄúIf the middle of the pot is the non-existence of the cloth, then the non-existence of the cloth would exist in the pot itself.‚Äù

original: rang nyid ces bya ba ni dngos po med pa gzhan la mi ltos par dngos po de'i dbus na gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rang nyid ces bya ba ni dngos po med pa gzhan la mi ltos par dngos po de'i dbus na gnas pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Itself‚Äù means that the non-existence does not depend on another thing, but exists in the middle of that thing.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dngos po med pa zhes smos te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa zhes smos te /
translated: It says, ‚Äúbecause of the non-existence of the cloth.‚ÄùüîΩ‚Äú That‚Äù means the non-existence of the cloth.

original: de'i zhes bya ba dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the nature of non-existence,

original: dngos po ni dngos po med pa las ldog pa na /
analyzed: dngos po ni dngos po med pa las ldog pa na /
translated: when the thing is the opposite of the non-existence,

original: dngos po med pa'i dbus su gnas pa yin la /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i dbus su gnas pa yin la /
translated: it exists in the middle of the non-existence.

original: dngos po med pa las ldog pa yang dngos po med pa gzhan dang ldan pas ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa las ldog pa yang dngos po med pa gzhan dang ldan pas ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the opposite of non-entity connected with another non-entity,

original: de ni rang nyid dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rang nyid dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is itself the nature of non-entity.

original: 'di nyid bsgrub pa'i don du dpe brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid bsgrub pa'i don du dpe brjod pa ni /
translated: In order to establish this very point, an example is stated:

original: la cha zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: la cha zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúlike a piece of wood.‚Äù

original: de yang ni la cha yang ngo //
analyzed: de yang ni la cha yang ngo //
translated: And that is also a piece of wood.

original: ci'i phyir gzhan yod pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gzhan yod pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not another?

original: rang nyid ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: rang nyid ces bya ba ste /
translated: ‚Äúitself‚Äù

original: sbyor ba byed pa gzhan med pa kho nar ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba byed pa gzhan med pa kho nar ro //
translated: means that there is no other agent of connection.

original: de lta bu zhes bya ba ni sbyor bar byed pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: de lta bu zhes bya ba ni sbyor bar byed pa nyid du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSuch‚Äù means as an agent of connection.

original: la cha ni rang nyid me la ltos te shing sbyor bar byed par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: la cha ni rang nyid me la ltos te shing sbyor bar byed par 'gyur gyi /
translated: The piece of wood itself, in dependence on fire, becomes the connector of the wood.

original: dngos po med pa ni rang nyid khyab pa'i dngos po'i dbus su gnas sam /
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni rang nyid khyab pa'i dngos po'i dbus su gnas sam /
translated: But a non-entity does not itself remain in the middle of an entity that pervades it,

original: ma khyab pa'i phyogs dang po la brjod @158a * //
analyzed: ma khyab pa'i phyogs dang po la brjod @158a * //
translated: or in the first part of a non-pervasive entity.

original: pa ni / dngos med ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: pa ni / dngos med ces bya ba'o //
translated: The statement about the first is ‚Äúnon-entity.‚Äù

original: gnyis pa la brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa la brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement about the second is ‚Äúif.‚Äù

original: don med 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dngos pos ma khyab pa nyid kyis bar na gnas pa 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don med 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dngos pos ma khyab pa nyid kyis bar na gnas pa 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIt would be pointless‚Äù means that since it is not pervaded by entities, it is established as being in the middle.

original: gal te rang gi ngo bos dngos po med pa'i bar na gnas na /
analyzed: gal te rang gi ngo bos dngos po med pa'i bar na gnas na /
translated: If it is in the middle because it is not an entity by its very essence,

original: de kho na bzhin du dngos po med pa'i dbus su yang ci ste mi gnas /
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du dngos po med pa'i dbus su yang ci ste mi gnas /
translated: why is it not in the middle of non-entity in the same way?

original: de lta na yang dngos po med pa'i gzhal bya smra ba ni don med do //
analyzed: de lta na yang dngos po med pa'i gzhal bya smra ba ni don med do //
translated: Even so, it is pointless to speak of an object of comprehension that is a non-entity.

original: nyes pa lhag pa brjod pa ni dngos po med pa gang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: nyes pa lhag pa brjod pa ni dngos po med pa gang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The additional fault is stated: ‚ÄúWhat non-entity?‚Äù

original: dngos po khyab pa nyid yin na skyon yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad kyi /
analyzed: dngos po khyab pa nyid yin na skyon yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad kyi /
translated: If it is pervaded by entities, it is not only a fault that it is not an entity.

original: 'on kyang gal te dngos po med pa yang khyab pa yin na de'i tshe khams gsum dngos po med pa nyid kyis khyab pa'i phyir dngos po'i dri tsam yang yod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang gal te dngos po med pa yang khyab pa yin na de'i tshe khams gsum dngos po med pa nyid kyis khyab pa'i phyir dngos po'i dri tsam yang yod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, if non-entity is also a pervader, then since the three realms are pervaded by non-entity, not even the mere scent of an entity would exist.

original: de med na yang /
analyzed: de med na yang /
translated: If that does not exist,

original: gang gi dbus su su zhig gnas par 'gyur //
analyzed: gang gi dbus su su zhig gnas par 'gyur //
translated: then who would be in the middle of what?

original: dngos med ngo bo nyid kyis ni //
analyzed: dngos med ngo bo nyid kyis ni //
translated: If non-entity is not an entity by its very essence,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'chad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of this is as follows:

original: dngos po med pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúnon-entity‚Äù is what is called ‚Äúnon-pervasion.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: ma khyab pa nyid dang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ma khyab pa nyid dang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚Äúbecause of non-pervasion.‚Äù

original: ma khyab pa nyid ma khyab par thal lo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ma khyab pa nyid ma khyab par thal lo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: non-pervasion is reduced to non-pervasion.

original: gal te dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: gal te dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'chad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of ‚Äúentity‚Äù and so on is as follows:

original: ma khyab pa nyid du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma khyab pa nyid du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúnon-pervasion‚Äù is what is called ‚Äúnon-pervasion.‚Äù

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni mi 'dre pa'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni mi 'dre pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to ‚Äúnon-mixture.‚Äù

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf‚Äù refers to the dispute.

original: gal te dngos pos khyab pa ma khyab bar byed na /
analyzed: gal te dngos pos khyab pa ma khyab bar byed na /
translated: If an entity is made non-pervasive by pervasion,

original: de'i tshe bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po de khyab par khas blangs ba na 'dres par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po de khyab par khas blangs ba na 'dres par 'gyur ro //
translated: then when that entity such as a pot is accepted as pervaded, it becomes mixed.

original: nam gyi tshe zhe na /
analyzed: nam gyi tshe zhe na /
translated: When?

original: dngos po med par ma 'dres par ma byas pa'i sngon rol du'o //
analyzed: dngos po med par ma 'dres par ma byas pa'i sngon rol du'o //
translated: Prior to the non-mixture of non-entity.

original: de lta ma yin mod snyam na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin mod snyam na /
translated: If you think that is not so,

original: phyi nas zhes smos te /
analyzed: phyi nas zhes smos te /
translated: then ‚Äúafterwards‚Äù is stated.

original: dngos po khyab pa ci ltar gzhan du ste ma khyab par 'gyur ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po khyab pa ci ltar gzhan du ste ma khyab par 'gyur ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: How can an entity with pervasion become otherwise, that is, non-pervasive? Why?

original: khyab pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyab pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúpervasion‚Äù is the name.

original: sngar zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pas ma 'dres par byas pa las sngar ro //
analyzed: sngar zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pas ma 'dres par byas pa las sngar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúPreviously‚Äù means before the non-entity is mixed in.

original: 'on te sngar ni dngos po ma khyab pa nyid med ba nyid do zhe na 'on zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: 'on te sngar ni dngos po ma khyab pa nyid med ba nyid do zhe na 'on zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: ‚ÄúBut if previously there is no non-pervasion of the entity, then‚Äù is the response.

original: de lta bu zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi rang bzhin dang ma 'dres pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi rang bzhin dang ma 'dres pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSuch‚Äù means not mixed in with the nature of another.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba 'dres pa'i rang bzhin du ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba 'dres pa'i rang bzhin du ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù means not seeing the nature of the mixture.

original: bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po ni khyab pa ma yin ma khyab pa yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po ni khyab pa ma yin ma khyab pa yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: A thing such as a pot is neither pervasion nor non-pervasion.

original: de med pa dang zhes bya ba ni khyab pa med pa dang ngo //üîΩde skad du yang /
analyzed: de med pa dang zhes bya ba ni khyab pa med pa dang ngo // de skad du yang /
translated: ‚ÄúIts non-existence‚Äù is the non-pervasion.

original: bhar ti ha ris bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: bhar ti ha ris bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus it is explained by Bhartrhari:üîΩThings that have the nature of elaboration

original: spros pa'i bdag nyid dngos rnams la //üîΩzhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: spros pa'i bdag nyid dngos rnams la //üîΩzhes bya ba ni /
translated: are not pervaded by the non-existence of the entity.

original: sgra'i tshangs pa'i rang bzhin du yongs su gyur pa rnams la shing ni shing ma yin pa las tha dad do zhes bya ba'i tha snyad gang @158b yin pa de ni gzhan gyi khyad par can te /üîΩphan tshun med pa'i khyad par can na /üîΩshing nyid kyi spyi'i khyab par can yin la /

original: rtogs pa yin no //üîΩgal te gnyis dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i grub pa'i mtha'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: rtogs pa yin no //üîΩgal te gnyis dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i grub pa'i mtha'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The term ‚Äútree‚Äù is a different

original: dper na rnam pa gzhan du rtogs pa'i gos la le brgan la sogs pa'i tshon rtsi dang ldan pas tshon dang ldan pa yin no zhes rtogs pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na rnam pa gzhan du rtogs pa'i gos la le brgan la sogs pa'i tshon rtsi dang ldan pas tshon dang ldan pa yin no zhes rtogs pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, it is just as when one understands that a cloth that is understood in a different way is endowed with a dye such as madder, and so one understands that it is endowed with the dye.

original: gal te tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i khyad par dang bral bar chos can gyi rang bzhin gyi dngos po de 'ba' zhig gzhan du rtogs pa yod na'o //
analyzed: gal te tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i khyad par dang bral bar chos can gyi rang bzhin gyi dngos po de 'ba' zhig gzhan du rtogs pa yod na'o //
translated: If the nature of the entity that is the subject were understood in a different way, as free from the distinction of being different or not different,

original: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: what would it be like?

original: gnyis dang bral bar te /
analyzed: gnyis dang bral bar te /
translated: Free from the two.

original: tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa dang bral bar ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa dang bral bar ro //
translated: Free from being different or not different.

original: de'i tshe gzhan te tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i khyad par gnyis dang ldan pas na /
analyzed: de'i tshe gzhan te tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i khyad par gnyis dang ldan pas na /
translated: At that time, since it is endowed with the two distinctions of being different or not different,

original: gang zhig tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i khyad par dang bral bar rtogs pa'i dngos po ste /
analyzed: gang zhig tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i khyad par dang bral bar rtogs pa'i dngos po ste /
translated: one would understand that the entity that is understood as free from the distinction of being different or not different

original: chos can gyi rang bzhin te gnyis la zhes bya ba tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa la brten ces smra bar rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos can gyi rang bzhin te gnyis la zhes bya ba tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa la brten ces smra bar rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: is the nature of the subject, and one would understand that it is based on the two, that is, on being different or not different.

original: 'di yang gzhan gyi lugs la brten nas brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang gzhan gyi lugs la brten nas brjod pa yin te /
translated: This also is stated in dependence on the system of others.

original: gang zhig rnam pa gzhan du rtogs ba de ni gzhan dang ldan pas rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur ba mi srid de /
analyzed: gang zhig rnam pa gzhan du rtogs ba de ni gzhan dang ldan pas rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur ba mi srid de /
translated: If one understands it in another way, it is impossible that it would transform into another aspect through possessing another,

original: de las gzhan dang ldan pas ni de la ci yang mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan dang ldan pas ni de la ci yang mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would not do anything to it through possessing another.

original: de ni rnam pa gzhan du rtogs pa yang ma yin na de ci ltar gzhan dang ldan pas gnyis la brten pa zhes bya bar rtogs /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gzhan du rtogs pa yang ma yin na de ci ltar gzhan dang ldan pas gnyis la brten pa zhes bya bar rtogs /
translated: If it is not understood in another aspect, how could it be understood as ‚Äúdependent on two‚Äù through possessing another?

original: de nyid kyi phyir de lta ma yin na ni zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de lta ma yin na ni zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúIf it were not like that,‚Äù

original: 'ba' zhig par rtogs pa med na'o //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig par rtogs pa med na'o //
translated: if it were not understood as solitary.

original: 'di ltar 'gyur te zhes bya ba 'di'i don brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'gyur te zhes bya ba 'di'i don brjod pa ni /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúit would be like this‚Äù is stated.

original: dngos de zhes bya ba chos can gyi rang bzhin gyi don dang / chos can de las gzhan tha dad ba dang tha mi dad pa gnyis dang / chos can dang tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa de rnams kyi 'brel ba ste de ltar de gsum rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'am rtog pa med pa'i shes pas rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos de zhes bya ba chos can gyi rang bzhin gyi don dang / chos can de las gzhan tha dad ba dang tha mi dad pa gnyis dang / chos can dang tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa de rnams kyi 'brel ba ste de ltar de gsum rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'am rtog pa med pa'i shes pas rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The so-called ‚Äúentity‚Äù is the meaning of the nature of the subject, and the two, different and not different from that subject, and the relation of those, the different and not different from the subject. In that way, those three are realized by a conceptual or non-conceptual consciousness.

original: ci ltar 'di gsum rang gi ngo bos rtogs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar 'di gsum rang gi ngo bos rtogs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How are those three realized by their own nature?

original: gang gi phyir khyad par rnams khyad par can dang lhan cig ma 'dres par ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir khyad par rnams khyad par can dang lhan cig ma 'dres par ro //
translated: Because the distinctions are not mixed with the distinguished.

original: 'on te rang gi ngo bo nyid du ni rtogs ba ma yin te /üîΩ'on kyang 'dres pa nyid du yin no snyam du dogs pa ni /
analyzed: 'on te rang gi ngo bo nyid du ni rtogs ba ma yin te / 'on kyang 'dres pa nyid du yin no snyam du dogs pa ni /
translated: But if it is thought that they are not realized by their own nature,üîΩbut rather they are mixed,

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the doubt is, ‚ÄúIf they are not mixed,üîΩhow are they realized?‚Äù

original: lan ni de lta na ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: lan ni de lta na ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The answer is, ‚ÄúIn that case,

original: ma 'dres pa @159a * //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa @159a * //
translated: if the unmixed

original: rnams la 'dres pa nyid du rtogs na ni 'khrul pa kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnams la 'dres pa nyid du rtogs na ni 'khrul pa kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: are realized as mixed, it would be just a mistake.‚Äù

original: khyad par gyi rang gi ngo bo 'dzin pa'i rtogs pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khyad par gyi rang gi ngo bo 'dzin pa'i rtogs pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there would be no cognition apprehending a particular intrinsic identity.

original: de ltar 'gyur mod snyam na /
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur mod snyam na /
translated: If you think that this is so,

original: de lta na ni zhes smos te 'khrul bar gyur na /
analyzed: de lta na ni zhes smos te 'khrul bar gyur na /
translated: then it is said, ‚ÄúIn that case,‚Äù if there were error,

original: khyad par gyi mtshan nyid du gyur pa'i don med pa ste yod pa'i tha snyad du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyad par gyi mtshan nyid du gyur pa'i don med pa ste yod pa'i tha snyad du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: there would be no object that is the characteristic of a particular, and the convention of existence would not occur.

original: 'o na sgra'i don gang zhig yin snyam na ma rig pa zhes bya ba ste rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan de kho na tsam zhig shing la sogs pa'i sgra rnams kyi don yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na sgra'i don gang zhig yin snyam na ma rig pa zhes bya ba ste rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan de kho na tsam zhig shing la sogs pa'i sgra rnams kyi don yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúWhat is the meaning of the term?‚Äù it is ignorance, and only that mere image of conception is the meaning of the terms tree and so on.

original: yang na 'on khyad par rnams 'dres pa kho na yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yang na 'on khyad par rnams 'dres pa kho na yin no zhe na /
translated: Or else, the particulars are just mixed.

original: de lta na ni zhes gsungs te tha mi dad par gyur na /
analyzed: de lta na ni zhes gsungs te tha mi dad par gyur na /
translated: In that case, it is said, if they were not distinct,

original: shing la sogs pa'i tshig rnams kyi don khyad par du gyur pa dag med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: shing la sogs pa'i tshig rnams kyi don khyad par du gyur pa dag med pa'i phyir te /
translated: the meanings of the terms tree and so on would not be particulars,

original: yod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and they would not exist.

original: de lta na ni khyad par dang ldan pa'i dngos po yang med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na ni khyad par dang ldan pa'i dngos po yang med par 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, things that possess distinctions would not exist,

original: med par med pas na me dang chu la sogs pa'i khyad par can rnams tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med par med pas na me dang chu la sogs pa'i khyad par can rnams tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because non-existence is non-existence, and things that possess distinctions, such as fire and water, are different.

original: des na shing la sogs pa'i tshig gis don tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i mtshan nyid ni mi rigs pa tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na shing la sogs pa'i tshig gis don tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i mtshan nyid ni mi rigs pa tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the characteristics of things that are different or not different from trees and so on are simply illogical.

original: gzhan yang shing gi mtshan nyid kyi dngos po sngar bum pa la sogs pa dag dang 'dres pa gang yin pa tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i khyad par gyi dbang gis khyad par gzhan dang ldan pa'i bum pa la sogs pa las tha dad pa dang
analyzed: gzhan yang shing gi mtshan nyid kyi dngos po sngar bum pa la sogs pa dag dang 'dres pa gang yin pa tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i khyad par gyi dbang gis khyad par gzhan dang ldan pa'i bum pa la sogs pa las tha dad pa dang
translated: Moreover, the entity that is the characteristic of a tree, which previously was mixed with pots and so on, is different from pots and so on that possess other distinctions due to the power of the distinction of being different or not different.

original: ldan la du ba la sogs pa'i gsal ba las ni tha mi dad pa dang ldan pa de ci khyad par dang ldan pa gzhan las zlog pa na ci ltar khyad par gyi dbang gis ldog pa dang rang gi gsal ba la ni rjes su 'jug pa de
analyzed: ldan la du ba la sogs pa'i gsal ba las ni tha mi dad pa dang ldan pa de ci khyad par dang ldan pa gzhan las zlog pa na ci ltar khyad par gyi dbang gis ldog pa dang rang gi gsal ba la ni rjes su 'jug pa de
translated: But if it is endowed with a particular, how is it that when it is distinguished from another endowed with a particular, it is distinguished by virtue of the particular, but when it is distinguished from its own manifestation, it is not distinguished by virtue of the particular?

original: kho na ltar khyad par yang khyad par gzhan gyi dbang gis ldog gam 'on te rang gi ngo bo kho nas yin /
analyzed: kho na ltar khyad par yang khyad par gzhan gyi dbang gis ldog gam 'on te rang gi ngo bo kho nas yin /
translated: Is the particular distinguished by virtue of another particular or by its own nature?

original: gal te khyad par gzhan gyi dbang gis ldog pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te khyad par gzhan gyi dbang gis ldog pa yin na /
translated: If it is distinguished by virtue of another particular,

original: de'i tshe yang khyad par gzhan gyi dbang gi yin pa'i phyir de ltar khyad par rnams thug pa med par gsal ba kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe yang khyad par gzhan gyi dbang gi yin pa'i phyir de ltar khyad par rnams thug pa med par gsal ba kho na'o //
translated: then it would be like that, and the particulars would be infinite, just like the manifestation.

original: des na phyogs gnyis pa la brjod pa ni /
analyzed: des na phyogs gnyis pa la brjod pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the second position is stated:

original: khyad par dang ldan pa de yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par dang ldan pa de yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat which is endowed with a particular‚Äù

original: gal te khyad par ni rang nyid kho na tha dad kyi /
analyzed: gal te khyad par ni rang nyid kho na tha dad kyi /
translated: If the particular is itself different,

original: khyad par dang ldan pa ni khyad par dang ldan pa gzhan las khyad par gyis ldog pa yin pa des na khyad par rtogs pa don med par ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par dang ldan pa ni khyad par dang ldan pa gzhan las khyad par gyis ldog pa yin pa des na khyad par rtogs pa don med par ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How could it be that the realization of the qualifier is pointless?

original: khyad par las ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par las ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom the qualifier‚Äù is said.

original: rang gi ngo bos khyad par las khyad par can tha dad yod na de'i tshe kho nas phyung la tha dad pa de nyid ces sbyar ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos khyad par las khyad par can tha dad yod na de'i tshe kho nas phyung la tha dad pa de nyid ces sbyar ro //
translated: If the qualified existed separately from the qualifier by its own nature, then it would be extracted by that alone. That very separateness is applied.

original: bltas pa la yang zhes @159b yang gi sgras ni khyad par sdud pa'o //
analyzed: bltas pa la yang zhes @159b yang gi sgras ni khyad par sdud pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAlso in the case of the qualifier‚Äù is said. The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù includes the qualifier.

original: khyad par la ltos te de tha dad pa 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad kyi 'on kyang khyad par dang ldan pa gzhan la ltos na yang yin no //
analyzed: khyad par la ltos te de tha dad pa 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad kyi 'on kyang khyad par dang ldan pa gzhan la ltos na yang yin no //
translated: Not only is it separate in dependence on the qualifier, but also in dependence on another that possesses the qualifier.

original: khyad par la ltos te rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa nyid gang yin pa de ni khyad par can la ltos te tha dad pa gang yin pa de las gzhan nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par la ltos te rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa nyid gang yin pa de ni khyad par can la ltos te tha dad pa gang yin pa de las gzhan nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: If that which is separate by its own nature in dependence on the qualifier is that which is separate in dependence on the qualified, it is just another.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: ‚ÄúNo‚Äù is the answer.

original: tha dad gzhan du yang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tha dad gzhan du yang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Also different from that means

original: khyad par can gzhan la ltos te brtags pas so //
analyzed: khyad par can gzhan la ltos te brtags pas so //
translated: that it is imagined in dependence on another, a different particular.

original: tha dad pa rnams la yang tha dad pa'i dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: tha dad pa rnams la yang tha dad pa'i dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: The anticipation of the objection that there is difference even among different things isüîΩThis difference also from that means that there is difference even from another, a different particular.

original: khyad par 'di las kyang zhes bya ba ni khyad par can gzhan las kyang tha dad ba'o zhes de snyam du sems pa'i blo skye ba'i phyir tha dad par 'gyur pa rnams kyi tha dad pa rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par 'di las kyang zhes bya ba ni khyad par can gzhan las kyang tha dad ba'o zhes de snyam du sems pa'i blo skye ba'i phyir tha dad par 'gyur pa rnams kyi tha dad pa rtogs pa'o //
translated: The understanding of the difference of those that are different is because the idea arises that they are different.

original: gal te tha dad par rtogs pa la don dam pa nyid brjod zin kho na ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te tha dad par rtogs pa la don dam pa nyid brjod zin kho na ma yin nam /
translated: If the ultimate itself has already been stated in the understanding of difference,

original: yang de brtags pa des ci ltar zhes dogs na /
analyzed: yang de brtags pa des ci ltar zhes dogs na /
translated: why is it imagined again?

original: tshad mas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshad mas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: By means of valid cognition.

original: don gang zhig tshad mas grub pa de ni don med kyang dor ba'i yul nyid du brtags par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don gang zhig tshad mas grub pa de ni don med kyang dor ba'i yul nyid du brtags par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: That object which is established by valid cognition cannot be imagined to be an object to be rejected even if it is meaningless.

original: tshad mas grub po zhe na ni de'i tshe gzung bar bya ba kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshad mas grub po zhe na ni de'i tshe gzung bar bya ba kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If it is established by valid cognition, then it is an object to be apprehended alone.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan no //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan no //
translated: The response to that is stated in the passage beginning with ‚ÄúIf, on the other hand, . . .‚Äù

original: gal te de ltar tha dad par gyur pa rnams la tha dad bar brtags na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar tha dad par gyur pa rnams la tha dad bar brtags na /
translated: If, on the other hand, you imagine that they are different from each other,

original: de'i tshe khyad par dang ldan pa gzhan 'ba' zhig las tha dad par ni ma zad kyi 'on kyang khyad par las kyang tha dad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de lta bur rnam par rtog pa'i phyir tha dad pa gzhan khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe khyad par dang ldan pa gzhan 'ba' zhig las tha dad par ni ma zad kyi 'on kyang khyad par las kyang tha dad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de lta bur rnam par rtog pa'i phyir tha dad pa gzhan khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: then, in that case, not only would the qualified be different from the mere other, but it would also be different from the qualifier. Since you would have to imagine it in that way, you would have to accept that the qualified is different from the other.

original: khas blangs pa'i khyad par de las kyang tha dad pa gzhan khas blang par bya ba yin pa'i phyir thug pa med do //
analyzed: khas blangs pa'i khyad par de las kyang tha dad pa gzhan khas blang par bya ba yin pa'i phyir thug pa med do //
translated: Since you would have to accept that the qualified is different from the other, which is different from the qualifier that you have already accepted, there would be an infinite regress.

original: des na khyad par las ni khyad par can rang gi ngo pos ldog pa yin no zhes bya ba de med par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni rang gi ngo bos ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na khyad par las ni khyad par can rang gi ngo pos ldog pa yin no zhes bya ba de med par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni rang gi ngo bos ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the statement ‚ÄúThe qualified is different from the qualifier by virtue of its own nature‚Äù would be undermined.

original: gal te tha dad pa khyad par gzhan la ltos par smra ba ni /
analyzed: gal te tha dad pa khyad par gzhan la ltos par smra ba ni /
translated: If you maintain that the difference of the qualified depends on another difference,

original: rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa med pa kho na'o zhes zhe la bzhag nas smras pa ni /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa med pa kho na'o zhes zhe la bzhag nas smras pa ni /
translated: and that they are not different in their own nature.

original: legs par byon te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: legs par byon te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is meant by ‚Äúyou have come well.‚Äù

original: grub pa'i mthar ni don 'di yin te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mthar ni don 'di yin te /
translated: The conclusion of the treatise is as follows:

original: khyad par dang ldan pa'i ngo bos gzhan la tha dad pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: khyad par dang ldan pa'i ngo bos gzhan la tha dad pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The nature of a thing that possesses a distinguishing feature is not different from the other.

original: rang bzhin gzhan gyis kyang tha dad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gzhan gyis kyang tha dad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Nor is it different from its own nature.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na 'di ltar tha dad par bya ba'i khyad par las tha dad pa med na tha dad par byed pa de yang gzhan yin par ci ltar 'gyur te mi 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na 'di ltar tha dad par bya ba'i khyad par las tha dad pa med na tha dad par byed pa de yang gzhan yin par ci ltar 'gyur te mi 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: Why is this? If the distinguishing feature that is to be distinguished is not different from the other, then how could the distinguishing feature itself be different from the other? It could not be!

original: 'jig rten gsum las chos can tha dad pa med pa yin na //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum las chos can tha dad pa med pa yin na //
translated: If the three worlds are not different from the thing that possesses the distinguishing feature,

original: tha dad par byed pa las kyang tha mi dad pa kho na'o //üîΩde lta na yang tha dad par @160a * //
analyzed: tha dad par byed pa las kyang tha mi dad pa kho na'o // de lta na yang tha dad par @160a * //
translated: then they are not different from the distinguishing feature itself.

original: byed pa chos can gyi rang bzhin du gyur pa na /
analyzed: byed pa chos can gyi rang bzhin du gyur pa na /
translated: Even so, when the distinguishing feature becomes the nature of the thing that possesses the distinguishing feature,

original: gzhan gyi rang bzhin gyi sgras brjod par bya ba nyid med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rang bzhin gyi sgras brjod par bya ba nyid med par 'gyur te /
translated: then the other nature is not expressed by the word.

original: des na gzhan gyi rang bzhin gyi tha dad par yin no zhes ci ltar brjod /
analyzed: des na gzhan gyi rang bzhin gyi tha dad par yin no zhes ci ltar brjod /
translated: Therefore, how can it be said that it is different in the nature of another?

original: 'di nyid brjod pa ni rang gi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid brjod pa ni rang gi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is being said: ‚Äúits own nature.‚Äù

original: tha dad pa ma yin pa ni chos can gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa ma yin pa ni chos can gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: ‚ÄúNot different‚Äù is the nature of the subject.

original: de zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi rang bzhin gyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi rang bzhin gyi khyad par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the distinction in the nature of another.

original: gzhan ma yin pa ni chos can gyi rang bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa ni chos can gyi rang bzhin nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúNot different‚Äù is the nature of the subject itself.

original: nam gyi tshe zhe na /
analyzed: nam gyi tshe zhe na /
translated: When?

original: chos can las tha dad pa ma yin na ni 'o //
analyzed: chos can las tha dad pa ma yin na ni 'o //
translated: If it is not different from the subject, then.

original: de zhes bya ba ni chos can no //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni chos can no //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the subject.

original: gzhan nyid ces bya ba ni gzhan du gyur pa'i tha dad par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan nyid ces bya ba ni gzhan du gyur pa'i tha dad par byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDifference‚Äù is the distinction that is different.

original: de med pa'i phyir te gzhan du gyur pa'i tha dad par byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir te gzhan du gyur pa'i tha dad par byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the absence of that, because of the absence of the distinction that is different.

original: de las zhes bya ba ni tha dad par byed pa'i chos las te /
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni tha dad par byed pa'i chos las te /
translated: ‚ÄúFrom that‚Äù refers to the property that is the distinction.

original: de'i dbang gis khyad par can gzhan las chos can tha dad par ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i dbang gis khyad par can gzhan las chos can tha dad par ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: By the power of that, how could the subject be different from the distinguished other?

original: tha dad par byed pa ci lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: tha dad par byed pa ci lta bu zhig ce na /
translated: What kind of difference?

original: chos can las rang gi ngo bos tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: chos can las rang gi ngo bos tha dad pa'o //
translated: It is different from the substratum by virtue of its own nature.

original: chos can gyi rang bzhin ci lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: chos can gyi rang bzhin ci lta bu zhig ce na /
translated: What is the nature of the substratum?

original: tha dad par byed pa tha dad pa de las rang bzhin tha dad pa med pa yang ngo //
analyzed: tha dad par byed pa tha dad pa de las rang bzhin tha dad pa med pa yang ngo //
translated: It is that which is not different from the difference-maker by virtue of its own nature.

original: yang ni lhag pa'i don to //
analyzed: yang ni lhag pa'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù has the sense of ‚Äúmoreover.‚Äù

original: gal te tha dad pa byed pa de ni rang nyid chos can las rang bzhin gyis tha dad pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te tha dad pa byed pa de ni rang nyid chos can las rang bzhin gyis tha dad pa yin na /
translated: If the difference-maker is itself different from the substratum by virtue of its own nature,

original: de'i tshe chos can gzhan yang tha dad par byed pa las de ltar tha dad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe chos can gzhan yang tha dad par byed pa las de ltar tha dad par 'gyur ro //
translated: then at that time the substratum would be different from the difference-maker in that way.

original: tha dad par byed pa chos can gyi rang bzhin las tha dad pa yin yang /
analyzed: tha dad par byed pa chos can gyi rang bzhin las tha dad pa yin yang /
translated: Even though the difference-maker is different from the substratum by virtue of its own nature,

original: chos can gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: chos can gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: it is the nature of the substratum.

original: de las tha dad par ci ltar 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: de las tha dad par ci ltar 'gyur snyam na /
translated: How could it be different from it?

original: gang gi phyir tha dad par byed pa chos can las ring du song ba ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir tha dad par byed pa chos can las ring du song ba ste /
translated: Because the difference-maker is far removed from the substratum,

original: chos can rgyang ring du spangs pas ni chos can gyi slar 'ong bar nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: chos can rgyang ring du spangs pas ni chos can gyi slar 'ong bar nus pa ma yin no //
translated: and the substratum, being far removed, is not able to return to the substratum.

original: gal te chos can gyis chos spangs te /
analyzed: gal te chos can gyis chos spangs te /
translated: If the subject were to abandon the property,

original: chos can gyi rang bzhin las tha dad pa nyams su myong na ;
analyzed: chos can gyi rang bzhin las tha dad pa nyams su myong na ;
translated: and if the subject were experienced as different from the nature of the property,

original: de'i tshe chos can yang chos kyi gam du slar 'ong ba ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe chos can yang chos kyi gam du slar 'ong ba ste /
translated: then at that time, the subject would return to the side of the property.

original: chos las tha mi dad pa nyams su myong bar byed nus par ci ltar 'gyur /

analyzed: gsal ba la ltos te rang bzhin gnyis po spyi'i rang bzhin nyid yin no zhe na /

analyzed: rang bzhin zhes bya ba'o //

original: lan ni gsal ba nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni gsal ba nyid ces bya ba'o //

original: de dang zhes bya ba ni gsal ba nyid kyis spyi dang ngo //
analyzed: de dang zhes bya ba ni gsal ba nyid kyis spyi dang ngo //

analyzed: rang bzhin gnyis ni mtshungs pa nyid du 'gyur gyi gsal ba'i rang bzhin ni ma yin la /

analyzed: de ni spyir yang 'thad pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: The statement is:

analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ste gsal ba nyid kyi spyi'o //

original: gsal ba las zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gnyis kyi mtshan nyid las so //
analyzed: gsal ba las zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gnyis kyi mtshan nyid las so //
translated: from manifestation, from the characteristic of the two natures,

original: 'on te khyab ba nyid du grub @162a * //
analyzed: 'on te khyab ba nyid du grub @162a * //
translated: Or is it established as a pervader?üîΩ

original: pa'i don du tha dad par rtogs pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: pa'i don du tha dad par rtogs pa yin no snyam na /
translated: Or do you think that the difference is established as the object of the universal?

original: rang bzhin gnyis su zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gnyis su zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The two natures are different.

original: thal bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ste de la yang spyi gzhan yod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de lta bu'i tshul du'o //
analyzed: thal bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ste de la yang spyi gzhan yod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de lta bu'i tshul du'o //

original: snga ma bzhin zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin snga ma dag nyid do //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin snga ma dag nyid do //
translated: The former natures are the previous natures.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar gsal ba nyid gsal ba rnams kyi rang bzhin ma yin pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar gsal ba nyid gsal ba rnams kyi rang bzhin ma yin pa de'i phyir ro //

original: des na zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa nyid kyis so //
translated: Therefore, by the difference, the manifestation is not the nature of the universal.

original: gsal ba nyid yin na rang bzhin gnyis po de spyi ma yin no //
analyzed: gsal ba nyid yin na rang bzhin gnyis po de spyi ma yin no //
translated: If the manifestation were the nature, those two natures would not be the universal.

original: 'o na spyi de dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'o na spyi de dang ldan pa'i phyir /

original: rang bzhin nyid spyi yin no zhes dogs pa ni /
analyzed: rang bzhin nyid spyi yin no zhes dogs pa ni /
translated: the nature itself is the universal.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you think that,

analyzed: lan ni de la zhes bya ba ste rang bzhin gnyis la'o zhes bya ba rang bzhin gnyis po'o //
translated: the response is: In that case, in the two natures, the two natures.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Because of the general

original: spyi dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: spyi dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: and the particular.

original: gsal ba rnams ni spyi dang ldan pas spyi ma yin no //
analyzed: gsal ba rnams ni spyi dang ldan pas spyi ma yin no //
translated: The particulars are not the general because they are endowed with the general.

original: gang gi phyir rang bzhin gnyis po spyi dang ldan pa yin gyi spyi ni ma yin pa des na'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang bzhin gnyis po spyi dang ldan pa yin gyi spyi ni ma yin pa des na'o //
translated: Because of the two natures, the general is endowed with the particular, but it is not the particular.üîΩWhy?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Because of that,

original: de zhes bya ba ste gsal ba'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ste gsal ba'o //
translated: that is, the particulars.

original: ci ste ldan ba ma yin zhe na ;
analyzed: ci ste ldan ba ma yin zhe na ;
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúAre they not endowed?,‚ÄùüîΩthe general

original: spyi'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: spyi'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: and the particular.

original: tha dad pas zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gnyis kyi mtshan nyid kyis so //
analyzed: tha dad pas zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gnyis kyi mtshan nyid kyis so //
translated: Because of difference means because of the characteristic of the two natures.

original: gal te rang bzhin gnyis dang ldan pa'i spyi'i gsal ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin gnyis dang ldan pa'i spyi'i gsal ba yin pa'i phyir /

original: spyi rang bzhin 'gas tha mi dad pa yang yin te /
analyzed: spyi rang bzhin 'gas tha mi dad pa yang yin te /
translated: then the general is not different from the particular because of its nature.

original: des na par chad pa ma yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na par chad pa ma yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not interrupted.

original: khyad par rang bzhin gnyis kyi bdag nyid can dang / spyi rang bzhin gnyis la brten pa de gnyis so //
analyzed: khyad par rang bzhin gnyis kyi bdag nyid can dang / spyi rang bzhin gnyis la brten pa de gnyis so //
translated: The particular has the nature of the two natures, and the general is based on the two natures.

original: lan ni de dag gi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni de dag gi zhes bya ba'o //

original: rang bzhin gang dag gis tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa de dag gi tha mi dad pa la yang ste gsal ba nyid du gyur pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: rang bzhin gang dag gis tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa de dag gi tha mi dad pa la yang ste gsal ba nyid du gyur pa la yang ngo //
translated: By virtue of which natures they are different or non-different, they are non-different, i.e., they are manifest.

original: 'phyo bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'phyo bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /

original: rang bzhin gnyis kyi bdag nyid can gyi spyi'i steng du lding ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gnyis kyi bdag nyid can gyi spyi'i steng du lding ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are flying in the sky of the universal which has the nature of the two natures.

original: de lta yin dang zhes bya ba ni 'phyo ba yin dang ngo //
analyzed: de lta yin dang zhes bya ba ni 'phyo ba yin dang ngo //

original: brten pa'i spyi dang spyi gsum pa'i rten gyi rang bzhin gyi spyi gnyis pa de dag gsal ba nyid do //
analyzed: brten pa'i spyi dang spyi gsum pa'i rten gyi rang bzhin gyi spyi gnyis pa de dag gsal ba nyid do //
translated: The universal of the substratum and the universal of the substratum of the third universal are the second universal which has the nature of the substratum.

original: des na zhes bya ba gsal ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba gsal ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means because of being manifest.

original: gsal ba las tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i rgyu mtshan spyi snga ma dag la mtshungs pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsal ba las tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i rgyu mtshan spyi snga ma dag la mtshungs pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The reason for being different or non-different from the manifest is not the same in the previous universals.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: spyi dang zhes bya ba spyi gsum pa dang me ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi dang zhes bya ba spyi gsum pa dang me ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the universal, i.e., the third universal, and because of possessing fire.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: spyi tha mas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: spyi tha mas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because of the final universal, i.e.,

original: spyi tha ma ni rang bzhin gnyis kyi bdag nyid can te /
analyzed: spyi tha ma ni rang bzhin gnyis kyi bdag nyid can te /
translated: The last universal has the nature of the two natures.

original: de'i 'og tu yang rang bzhin gnyis pa'i spyi gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu yang rang bzhin gnyis pa'i spyi gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'on te spyi tha ma @162b las gsum pa tha mi dad par yang 'dod de des na chos pa yin no zhe na /

analyzed: de lta na 'on spyi de yang rang bzhin gnyis pa yin pa'i phyir de la yang spyi gzhan 'phyo bar 'gyur ro //

original: des gsal ba nyid yin pas spyi snga ma mtshungs pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: des gsal ba nyid yin pas spyi snga ma mtshungs pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /

original: spyi dang mi ldan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: spyi dang mi ldan pa'i phyir te /

original: spyi thams bar mod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi thams bar mod pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de lta yin dang chod bas spyi dang mi ldan pa'i phyir gcig kyang mtshungs par mi 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni des na zhes bya ba'o // gcig kyang zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i rang bzhin nam /

original: rang bzhin gnyis pa'i spyi'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gnyis pa'i spyi'o //
translated: Even a single entity means either a manifestation or a universal with two natures.

original: des na zhes bya ba gsal ba'i rang bzhin ni rnam pa mtshungs pa ma yin pas na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba gsal ba'i rang bzhin ni rnam pa mtshungs pa ma yin pas na'o //

original: rtogs pa gang la spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po med pa de ni dngos po dang mi ldan pa'i rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa gang la spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po med pa de ni dngos po dang mi ldan pa'i rtogs pa'o //

original: ci ltar dngos po dang mi ldan snyam na /
analyzed: ci ltar dngos po dang mi ldan snyam na /

original: nges ba med par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nges ba med par zhes bya ba'o //

original: 'on te rdzogs pa yod pa kho na ste /
analyzed: 'on te rdzogs pa yod pa kho na ste /

original: 'di ga las she na /
analyzed: 'di ga las she na /

analyzed: de la zhes smos te rang bzhin gnyis pa tha ma la'o //

analyzed: spyi gzhan mi 'dod pa ni ma nges par smra ba'o //

analyzed: snga ma la yang zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gnyis pa la'o //

analyzed: de'i phyir gsal ba kho na rtogs pa'i spyod yul yin te /

analyzed: des na mtshungs pa'i rnam pa can gyi rtogs pa ni dmigs pa med pa kho na'o //

analyzed: 'o na gang med pas dmigs dang bcas par 'gyur ba ci ltar 'di dmigs ba dang bcas pa yin zhen /

translated: Because if one accepts that a universal is not different from instances,

original: de ni spyi ma yin par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de ni spyi ma yin par 'gyur gyi /
translated: it would not be a universal.

original: 'on kyang de ni gsal ba nyid yin par 'gyur ro //üîΩ'on de nyid spyi yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang de ni gsal ba nyid yin par 'gyur ro //üîΩ'on de nyid spyi yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But it would be an instance.üîΩIf you say, ‚ÄúIt is just that which is a universal,‚Äù

original: de yang ma yin te tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de yang ma yin te tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: That is not so, because they are not different.

original: de yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That is not so is the reply.

original: phyir te de'i phyir rigs dang gsal ba dag kyang tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phyir te de'i phyir rigs dang gsal ba dag kyang tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: Because of that, the class and the individual are not different.

original: des na zhes bya ba tha mi dad pas na /
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba tha mi dad pas na /
translated: Therefore, because of the non-difference,

original: gnyis med nyid du ste don dngos po med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis med nyid du ste don dngos po med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the two are non-existent, that is, the object is non-existent.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar dngos por gyur pa'i spyi mi 'thad pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar dngos por gyur pa'i spyi mi 'thad pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of that, the class that is a real entity is not tenable.üîΩTherefore, it is mere ignorance.

original: ma rig ba tsam nyid du 'gyur zhes bya ba de bshad pa'i don du phyogs snga ma nye par 'god pa ni /
analyzed: ma rig ba tsam nyid du 'gyur zhes bya ba de bshad pa'i don du phyogs snga ma nye par 'god pa ni /
translated: In order to explain that, the prior position is set forth:

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If that is so,

original: de'i tshe ni gsal ba las tha dad ba med pa /üîΩldog pa'i rang bzhin rnam par phye nas ci ltar yang rtogs par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe ni gsal ba las tha dad ba med pa / ldog pa'i rang bzhin rnam par phye nas ci ltar yang rtogs par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: then, because of the non-difference from the individual,üîΩthe universal is not tenable.

original: 'o na gang gi tshe rnam par phye nas rtogs snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na gang gi tshe rnam par phye nas rtogs snyam na /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúHow is it understood by distinguishing the nature of the exclusion?,‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúWhen it is distinguished.‚Äù

original: tha dad pa 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad kyi tha mi dad par yang rtogs zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: tha dad pa 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad kyi tha mi dad par yang rtogs zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: Not only are they different, but they are also realized as non-different.

original: khra bo la sogs pa tha dad pa dag dang 'dra ba gcig pa nyid gang yin pa de gang la yod pa'i tha dad pa med ba de ltar yang rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khra bo la sogs pa tha dad pa dag dang 'dra ba gcig pa nyid gang yin pa de gang la yod pa'i tha dad pa med ba de ltar yang rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: That which is the same as the different, such as the variegated, etc., is also realized as non-different, in the sense that it exists in that which is non-different.

original: don dam par gsal ba las tha mi dad kyang tha snyad du tha dad par rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don dam par gsal ba las tha mi dad kyang tha snyad du tha dad par rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that ultimately it is non-different from the manifest, but conventionally it is realized as different.

original: gal te don dam par gsal ba las tha mi dad pa ci ltar tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa nyid du rtogs par 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: gal te don dam par gsal ba las tha mi dad pa ci ltar tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa nyid du rtogs par 'gyur snyam na /
translated: If one thinks, ‚ÄúHow can it be realized as both different and non-different from the manifest, if ultimately it is non-different from the manifest?,‚Äù

original: yul zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yul zhes bya ba'o //
translated: it is said, ‚Äúthe object.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir tha dad pa yod kyang rtogs par mi nus snyam na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir tha dad pa yod kyang rtogs par mi nus snyam na /
translated: If one thinks, ‚ÄúWhy is it that even though it exists as different, it cannot be realized as such?,‚Äù

original: der zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: der zhes bya ba'o //
translated: it is said, ‚Äúthere.‚Äù

original: 'o na dbyi bas tsam nyid @163b yod do snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na dbyi bas tsam nyid @163b yod do snyam na /
translated: If one thinks, ‚ÄúThen it exists as just the manifest,‚Äù

original: khyad par dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: it is said, ‚Äúthe distinction.‚Äù

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: If one thinks, ‚ÄúWhat is it?,‚Äù

original: yul thag ring po zhes smos so //
analyzed: yul thag ring po zhes smos so //
translated: it is said, ‚Äúthe distant object.‚Äù

original: de ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: de ni khyad par ro //
translated: That is the difference.

original: snang ba tsam ni dbyibs tsam mo //
analyzed: snang ba tsam ni dbyibs tsam mo //
translated: The mere appearance is the mere shape.

original: thams cad du zhes skyes bu la yang /
analyzed: thams cad du zhes skyes bu la yang /
translated: Everywhere means also in the person.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni snang ba tsam mo //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni snang ba tsam mo //
translated: That itself means the mere appearance.

original: 'on ci ltar tha mi dad snyam na /
analyzed: 'on ci ltar tha mi dad snyam na /
translated: But how are they not different?

original: snang ba dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: snang ba dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The mere appearance and the mere shape are not different.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni snang ba tsam mo //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni snang ba tsam mo //
translated: That itself means the mere appearance.

original: dogs pa ni don dam pa nyid du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dogs pa ni don dam pa nyid du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The doubt is in the ultimate.

original: lan ni gcig tu zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni gcig tu zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is in one way.

original: gnyis zhes bya ba ni snang ba dang rnam par brtags ba dag go //
analyzed: gnyis zhes bya ba ni snang ba dang rnam par brtags ba dag go //
translated: The two are the mere appearance and the mere imagined.

original: 'o na ni zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'o na ni zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
translated: But then is the doubt.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: spyi nyid ces bya ba ste khyad par ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: spyi nyid ces bya ba ste khyad par ma yin pa'o //
translated: The universal itself, not the particular.

original: gal te de lta na yang ci ltar tha dad snyam na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na yang ci ltar tha dad snyam na /
translated: But if that is so, how are they not different?

original: gang zhig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba'o //
translated: The doubt is in what.

original: lan ni de yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni de yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is that also.

original: gong bu dang 'brel ba med pa'i rang bzhin du snang na gsal ba dang ma 'dres pa'i rang bzhin de ni spyir der mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gong bu dang 'brel ba med pa'i rang bzhin du snang na gsal ba dang ma 'dres pa'i rang bzhin de ni spyir der mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it appears as a nature not related to the individual, then that nature, which is clear and unmixed, would not be a universal in general.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir ci ltar gsal ba'i rang bzhin spyi la mi ltos ba de bzhin du ni gsal bal mi ltos pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ci ltar gsal ba'i rang bzhin spyi la mi ltos ba de bzhin du ni gsal bal mi ltos pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Because, just as the nature of the clear does not depend on the universal, it is not that it does not depend on the clear.

original: 'on kyang gsal ba'i rang bzhin dang 'brel pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang gsal ba'i rang bzhin dang 'brel pa kho na'o //
translated: However, it is only related to the nature of the clear.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni gang dang ldan pas spyi rnams mtshungs pa nyid yin pa de las pha rol gyi spyi ni gsal ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni gang dang ldan pas spyi rnams mtshungs pa nyid yin pa de las pha rol gyi spyi ni gsal ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, the universal that is other than that from which the universals are the same would be the clear itself.

original: des na gsal ba'i rang bzhin ltar 'ba' zhig pa ni spyi la yin no zhes gnas ba kho na'o //
analyzed: des na gsal ba'i rang bzhin ltar 'ba' zhig pa ni spyi la yin no zhes gnas ba kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, it is only the nature of the clear that is the universal.

original: dogs pa bsu ba ni'o na ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dogs pa bsu ba ni'o na ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Anticipating an objection, he says, But then...

original: ci ltar rtogs pa ci yin snyam na /
analyzed: ci ltar rtogs pa ci yin snyam na /
translated: What is the understanding?

original: de ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That is...

original: 'o na zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: 'o na zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: But then... is the response.

original: ci ltar mi 'gyur snyam na blo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci ltar mi 'gyur snyam na blo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: How is that? The mind...

original: 'khrul bas zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'khrul bas zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBy error‚Äù means ‚Äúdoubtfully.‚Äù

original: lan ni 'khrul pas 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lan ni 'khrul pas 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The answer is: ‚ÄúIt does not operate by error.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhen /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhen /
translated: Why?

original: gzhan zhes bya ba 'khrul ba'i blo'i rang bzhin las gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba 'khrul ba'i blo'i rang bzhin las gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no other than that which is the nature of the erroneous cognition.

original: khas blangs nas gyang nyes pa brjod pa ni de'i tshe yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: khas blangs nas gyang nyes pa brjod pa ni de'i tshe yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Having accepted that, the fault is stated: ‚ÄúAt that time, too,‚Äù

original: 'khrul pa gzhan gyi tshe yang ngo //
analyzed: 'khrul pa gzhan gyi tshe yang ngo //
translated: at the time of the other error.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni gsal ba rtogs pa med pas na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni gsal ba rtogs pa med pas na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means: because of the non-apprehension of the manifestation.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf‚Äù means ‚Äúdoubtfully.‚Äù

original: tha dad pa dang cig shos ni tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa dang cig shos ni tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDifferent and not different‚Äù means ‚Äúdifferent and not different.‚Äù

original: lan ni 'os gzhan zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni 'os gzhan zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is: ‚ÄúThere is no other possibility.‚Äù

original: de dag spyi dang ldan pa la sogs pa bkag pas na 'os gzhan med pas rnam par gcod pa'i 'bras bu can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag spyi dang ldan pa la sogs pa bkag pas na 'os gzhan med pas rnam par gcod pa'i 'bras bu can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the negation of the possession of universals, etc., there is no other possibility. It has the effect of exclusion.

original: des na rnam par gcod pa rtogs pa dor nas sgra'i don rtogs pa la tshul gzhan ni tshad ma ci 'dra ba zhig yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na rnam par gcod pa rtogs pa dor nas sgra'i don rtogs pa la tshul gzhan ni tshad ma ci 'dra ba zhig yod par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, having rejected the understanding of the exclusion, what kind of valid cognition could there be for the understanding of the meaning of the word?

original: tshul med pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩgal te 'os gzhan med pa yin yang rgyud gzhan dang 'brel ba'i rnam par gcod @164a * //
analyzed: tshul med pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to // gal te 'os gzhan med pa yin yang rgyud gzhan dang 'brel ba'i rnam par gcod @164a * //
translated: The meaning is that there is none at all.

original: pa rtogs pa ni mi 'grub ste tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro zhes dogs pa ni /
analyzed: pa rtogs pa ni mi 'grub ste tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro zhes dogs pa ni /
translated: Even if there is no other option, the understanding of the exclusion connected to another continuum is not established because there is no valid cognition.üîΩThis is the doubt.

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning of if is as follows.

original: dngos po rnam par 'jog pa zhes bya ba ni rgyud gzhan dang 'brel pa rnam par gcod pa rtogs pa rnam par 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po rnam par 'jog pa zhes bya ba ni rgyud gzhan dang 'brel pa rnam par gcod pa rtogs pa rnam par 'jog pa'o //
translated: The statement the determination of the thing means the determination of the understanding of the exclusion connected to another continuum.

original: nges pa'i yul la 'jug pa gzhan du mi 'thad pas rnam par gcod pa rtogs pa 'grub bo zhes lan 'debs pa ni /
analyzed: nges pa'i yul la 'jug pa gzhan du mi 'thad pas rnam par gcod pa rtogs pa 'grub bo zhes lan 'debs pa ni /
translated: Since it is not tenable for the engagement in a definite object to be otherwise, the understanding of the exclusion is established. The answer is as follows.

original: de las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement from that is as follows.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni de las gzhan rnam par bcad nas 'jug pas na'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni de las gzhan rnam par bcad nas 'jug pas na'o //
translated: The statement that is because it engages by excluding that which is other than that.

original: gal te rnam par gcod pa dogs pa ni med pa kho na yin nam /
analyzed: gal te rnam par gcod pa dogs pa ni med pa kho na yin nam /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúIs it only the exclusion that is apprehended, or is the object that is excluded also apprehended?üîΩ‚Äù

original: de ci ltar 'jug pa gzhan du mi 'thad pas gzhan la yod par rtogs snyam na /
analyzed: de ci ltar 'jug pa gzhan du mi 'thad pas gzhan la yod par rtogs snyam na /
translated: If you think that the object that is excluded is apprehended because it is not tenable that the exclusion occurs without engaging the object that is excluded,

original: rang gi rgyud la grub pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: rang gi rgyud la grub pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: then we say that the exclusion is established in relation to one‚Äôs own continuum.

original: de ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin that case‚Äù refers to the exclusion.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i yul can ma yin pas na'o //üîΩ'dis ni tshad ma 'di mngon par 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i yul can ma yin pas na'o // 'dis ni tshad ma 'di mngon par 'dod pa yin te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause it is not an object that exists‚Äù means that it is not an object that exists as a real entity.üîΩThis passage indicates that the exclusion is a valid form of knowledge.

original: gang zhig nges pa'i yul la 'jug ba de ni rnam par gcod pa rtogs pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig nges pa'i yul la 'jug ba de ni rnam par gcod pa rtogs pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin te /
translated: Whatever engages an object that is ascertained is preceded by the apprehension of an exclusion.

original: dper na bdag nyid kyi bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bdag nyid kyi bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like one‚Äôs own face.

original: tha snyad pa rnams kyi 'jug pa yang nges pa'i yul la 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tha snyad pa rnams kyi 'jug pa yang nges pa'i yul la 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The engagement of those who use conventional expressions also engages an object that is ascertained.

original: ldog pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: ldog pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po la gnas pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe object that is excluded‚Äù means that it is an object that exists as a real entity.

original: dum bur bkol te ldog pa rtogs pa yang mi bden no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dum bur bkol te ldog pa rtogs pa yang mi bden no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is not tenable that the exclusion is apprehended‚Äù means that it is not tenable that the exclusion is apprehended in the manner in which it is expressed.

original: ldog pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i yang yul yin no zhes lan brjod pa ni /üîΩdngos po zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'o //
analyzed: ldog pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i yang yul yin no zhes lan brjod pa ni / dngos po zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'o //
translated: The reply is:üîΩThe thing is the object of the conceptual differentiation that appears.

original: ldog pa'i zhes bya ba ni rnam par gcod pa'i 'brel pa'i yul lo //
analyzed: ldog pa'i zhes bya ba ni rnam par gcod pa'i 'brel pa'i yul lo //
translated: The exclusion is the object of the relation of exclusion.

original: de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: rtog pa spyod yul te rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa spyod yul te rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The domain of conceptual differentiation is the aspect of conceptual differentiation.

original: 'on te yang rtog pa'i spyod yul gyi dngos po gang yod pa ni yod pa nyid yin mod kyi 'on kyang 'di ni mi bden pa yin ne snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te yang rtog pa'i spyod yul gyi dngos po gang yod pa ni yod pa nyid yin mod kyi 'on kyang 'di ni mi bden pa yin ne snyam na /
translated: But if one thinks that the thing which is the domain of conceptual differentiation is indeed existent, but that it is not real,

original: bden dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bden dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the reply is:üîΩThe real and the unreal.

original: gang thob par bya ba ni bden pa yin la /
analyzed: gang thob par bya ba ni bden pa yin la /
translated: That which is to be attained is real.üîΩThat which is imagined is unreal.üîΩThus, no one imagines that the appearance and the conceptual differentiation of reality and unreality are different.

original: gang zhig rnam par brtags pa de ni mi bden pa yin no zhes de ltar bden pa dang bden pa ma yin pa nyid du snang ba dang rnam par rtog par bya ba dag tha dad par ni su yang rtog par mi byed do zhes bya ba'i don
analyzed: gang zhig rnam par brtags pa de ni mi bden pa yin no zhes de ltar bden pa dang bden pa ma yin pa nyid du snang ba dang rnam par rtog par bya ba dag tha dad par ni su yang rtog par mi byed do zhes bya ba'i don
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: to // gal te bden pa gnyis la sogs par rtog pa med na /
analyzed: to // gal te bden pa gnyis la sogs par rtog pa med na /
translated: If there is no conception of the two truths, etc.,

original: rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i dngos po dngos po tsam las /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i dngos po dngos po tsam las /
translated: then, from the mere thing that appears to conception,

original: khyed ltar tha snyad pa bdag cag ldog pa rtogs pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: khyed ltar tha snyad pa bdag cag ldog pa rtogs pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: you do not understand the exclusion of the opposite, as we do, through the conventional.

original: ldog dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ldog dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is stated.

original: ci tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ci tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: To what extent?

original: bden brdzun gyi rnam par dbye ba dang / bral ba rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i dngos po tsam gyis te /
analyzed: bden brdzun gyi rnam par dbye ba dang / bral ba rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i dngos po tsam gyis te /
translated: Through the mere thing that appears to conception, which is free from the differentiation of true and false.

original: ldog pa phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa'i rnam pa la 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: ldog pa phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa'i rnam pa la 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: It is just the aspect of the nonerroneous understanding of the exclusion.

original: khyed la @164b yang ldog pa rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dgos pa grub pa'i don du de tsam gyis chog mod /üîΩmtshungs par rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i rang bzhin nyams su myong ba gnyis las /
analyzed: khyed la @164b yang ldog pa rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dgos pa grub pa'i don du de tsam gyis chog mod / mtshungs par rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i rang bzhin nyams su myong ba gnyis las /
translated: For you, it is sufficient that the purpose of the definition of the understanding of the exclusion is accomplished through that.

original: gcig la ni ldog pa rtogs pa yod la gzhan la ni med do zhes ni mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gcig la ni ldog pa rtogs pa yod la gzhan la ni med do zhes ni mi 'thad do //
translated: But it is not tenable to say that one of the two, the experience of the nature that appears to conception, has the understanding of the exclusion and the other does not.

original: gal te rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i dngos po tsam gyis dgos pa 'grub kyang de tha dad par ci ste mi rtog snyam na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i dngos po tsam gyis dgos pa 'grub kyang de tha dad par ci ste mi rtog snyam na /
translated: If the mere appearance of an entity in a conceptual cognition accomplishes the purpose, then why not think that it is different?

original: gal te thun mong du rnam par rtog pa la snang ba tsam gyi dngos po'i spyis ldog pa rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dgos pa 'grub na de'i tshe rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par bye brag ste brtags pa de la yon tan ci zhig yod de 'ga' yang
analyzed: gal te thun mong du rnam par rtog pa la snang ba tsam gyi dngos po'i spyis ldog pa rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dgos pa 'grub na de'i tshe rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par bye brag ste brtags pa de la yon tan ci zhig yod de 'ga' yang
translated: If the mere appearance of an entity in a conceptual cognition, in common, accomplishes the purpose, which is characterized by the understanding of the exclusion, then what good quality is there in the conceptual image of that conceptual cognition?üîΩThere is none at all.

original: med do // gal te bden pa'i dngos po dang 'brel pa kho nas rnam par gcod par rtog par nus pa yin gyi gzhan gyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: med do // gal te bden pa'i dngos po dang 'brel pa kho nas rnam par gcod par rtog par nus pa yin gyi gzhan gyis ni ma yin te /
translated: If one thinks that exclusion is possible only through the connection with a real entity and not through anything else,üîΩthen how is it possible to understand exclusion through that alone?

original: de ni ci ltar de tsam gyis ldog pa rtogs par nus snyam pa'i dogs pa bsu bas rkan pa bzhi ba rnams par 'grel ba ni /
analyzed: de ni ci ltar de tsam gyis ldog pa rtogs par nus snyam pa'i dogs pa bsu bas rkan pa bzhi ba rnams par 'grel ba ni /
translated: In order to anticipate this doubt, the fourth line of the verse is the commentary:

original: bden pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bden pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe exclusion of what is not that.‚Äù

original: ci ltar nges ba 'di med ce na /
analyzed: ci ltar nges ba 'di med ce na /
translated: How is this ascertainment not possible?

original: bden pa dang 'brel pa ma yin pa rnam par brtag pa'i rnam pas kyang ldog pa ste rtogs par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden pa dang 'brel pa ma yin pa rnam par brtag pa'i rnam pas kyang ldog pa ste rtogs par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is seen that exclusion is understood even by means of a consideration that is not related to reality.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar mi bden pa dang 'brel pas kyang rnam par gcod pa rtogs pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar mi bden pa dang 'brel pas kyang rnam par gcod pa rtogs pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: Because exclusion is understood even by means of a consideration that is not related to reality.

original: ngag rnam par gcod pa'i yul can kho na yin no zhes bya ba ci ltar nges she na /
analyzed: ngag rnam par gcod pa'i yul can kho na yin no zhes bya ba ci ltar nges she na /
translated: How is it ascertained that the object of exclusion is only the word?

original: de la zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ste /
translated: In that case,

original: ngag gis bstan pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa la gnas pa'i rnam par gcod pa la'o //
analyzed: ngag gis bstan pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa la gnas pa'i rnam par gcod pa la'o //
translated: in exclusion that is based on the aspect of the conceptual differentiation that is taught by the word.

original: 'dis ni phyed phyi ma bshad do //
analyzed: 'dis ni phyed phyi ma bshad do //
translated: This explains the second half of the verse.

original: dngos po mi bden na ldog pa yang ci ltar bden zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: dngos po mi bden na ldog pa yang ci ltar bden zhes 'brel to //
translated: If the thing is unreal, how can the exclusion be real?üîΩIn that case,

original: de la te dngos po mi bden pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de la te dngos po mi bden pa la gnas pa'o //
