original: gzhan gnyis so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan gnyis so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase the other two refers to

original: gzhal bya nyid dang mnyan bya nyid do //
analyzed: gzhal bya nyid dang mnyan bya nyid do //
translated: the reasons based on non-cognition and the reasons based on the nature of the effect.üîΩThe phrase just those refers to the reasons based on non-cognition and the reasons based on the nature of the effect.üîΩThe phrase just those two refers to the reasons based on non-cognition and the reasons based on the nature of the effect.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase the other two refers to

original: ldog pa'i sgo nas go byed yin pas na'o //
analyzed: ldog pa'i sgo nas go byed yin pas na'o //
translated: the reasons based on non-cognition and the reasons based on the nature of the effect.üîΩThe phrase just those refers to the reasons based on non-cognition and the reasons based on the nature of the effect.üîΩThe phrase just those two refers to the reasons based on non-cognition and the reasons based on the nature of the effect.üîΩThe phrase the other two refers toüîΩthe reasons based on non-cognition and the reasons based on the nature of the effect.

original: gang dag mthun pa'i phyogs gang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag la yod pa dang med pa dang / @169a * //
analyzed: gang dag mthun pa'i phyogs gang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag la yod pa dang med pa dang / @169a * //
translated: Those that exist and do not exist in the similar and dissimilar classes,üîΩand the nine types of property of the subject that are expressed in two ways.

original: rnam pa gnyis su yang brjod pa phyogs kyi chos rnam pa dgu po de dag kyang gang dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis su yang brjod pa phyogs kyi chos rnam pa dgu po de dag kyang gang dag yin zhe na /
translated: What are those nine types of property of the subject?

original: phyogs kyi chos dgu po de dag ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos dgu po de dag ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Those nine types of property of the subject are

original: rtag sogs la zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba la'o //
analyzed: rtag sogs la zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba la'o //
translated: with respect to the probandum, such as permanence, etc.

original: 'das pas ci ltar du ma nyid ces bya ba rnam pa bzhi nyid du'o //
analyzed: 'das pas ci ltar du ma nyid ces bya ba rnam pa bzhi nyid du'o //
translated: How is it that non-eternality, etc. are fourfold? It is fourfold in terms of the four types.

original: grub pa'i mthar ni don 'di yin te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mthar ni don 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of the conclusion is this:

original: rtsol ba las byung ba dang byas pa gnyis rang gi ngo bos rnam pa bzhi med kyang /
analyzed: rtsol ba las byung ba dang byas pa gnyis rang gi ngo bos rnam pa bzhi med kyang /
translated: Although effort-produced and produced do not exist by their own nature in four ways,

original: gcor gyur pa'i bsgrub bya'i dbye ba las rnam pa bzhi yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gcor gyur pa'i bsgrub bya'i dbye ba las rnam pa bzhi yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: they are fourfold due to the classification of the probandum.

original: 'di nyid brjod pa ni rang gi ngo bos ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid brjod pa ni rang gi ngo bos ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is stated as by their own nature, etc.

original: des na ni 'thad pas na'o //
analyzed: des na ni 'thad pas na'o //
translated: Therefore means because of that.

original: byas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rtsod pa'o //
analyzed: byas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rtsod pa'o //
translated: Produced, etc. is the dispute.

original: de'i mtshan nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan no //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan no //
translated: The response to that is: ‚ÄúIts nature, etc.‚Äù

original: byas pa la ni rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid dang / rtsol ba las byung ba nyid la ni 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid yod do //
analyzed: byas pa la ni rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid dang / rtsol ba las byung ba nyid la ni 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid yod do //
translated: For that which is produced, there is the nature of a nature, and for that which arises from effort, there is the nature of an effect.

original: byas pa la ni rang bzhin las gzhan 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid med la /
analyzed: byas pa la ni rang bzhin las gzhan 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid med la /
translated: For that which is produced, there is no nature of an effect that is different from the nature of a nature.

original: rtsol ba las byung ba la ni 'bras bu nyid las gzhan gyi mtshan nyid med do //
analyzed: rtsol ba las byung ba la ni 'bras bu nyid las gzhan gyi mtshan nyid med do //
translated: For that which arises from effort, there is no nature that is different from the effect.

original: de'i phyir bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir bzlog pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the reversal is:

original: byas pa nyid ni 'bras bu la brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba nyid du rang bzhin ma yin no //
analyzed: byas pa nyid ni 'bras bu la brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba nyid du rang bzhin ma yin no //
translated: That which is produced is not by nature that which arises immediately after the effect and the effort.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rang bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúnature.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir 'bras bu go bar bya ba la ma khyab kyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'bras bu go bar bya ba la ma khyab kyi /
translated: Because the effect is not pervaded by the object of understanding,

original: 'on kyang rang bzhin kho nas khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rang bzhin kho nas khyab pa yin no //
translated: but rather it is pervaded by nature alone.

original: khyab pa kho na ni ma yin te /
analyzed: khyab pa kho na ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not pervaded by that alone,

original: sha ba nyid kyis shing nyid la ma khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sha ba nyid kyis shing nyid la ma khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the nature of a tree is not pervaded by the nature of a ≈õim≈õapƒÅ.

original: ci'i phyir 'bras bus ma khyab snyam na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'bras bus ma khyab snyam na /
translated: Why is it not pervaded by the effect?

original: rgyu ni 'bras bu la 'khrul pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu ni 'bras bu la 'khrul pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is possible that the cause is mistaken with regard to the effect.

original: 'khrul pa de'i phyir 'bras bu ni rgyu la rnam pa gnyis su 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: 'khrul pa de'i phyir 'bras bu ni rgyu la rnam pa gnyis su 'jug pa yin no //
translated: And because of that mistake, the effect is twofold with regard to the cause.

original: rang bzhin gyis ci ltar khyab snyam na /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ci ltar khyab snyam na /
translated: How is it pervaded by nature?

original: byas pa nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: byas pa nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said, ‚Äúbecause of being produced.‚Äù

original: ci ltar na 'bras bu rnam pa gnyis su 'jug snyam na /
analyzed: ci ltar na 'bras bu rnam pa gnyis su 'jug snyam na /
translated: How is the effect twofold?

original: mi rtag pa tsam gyis zhes smos so //
analyzed: mi rtag pa tsam gyis zhes smos so //
translated: It is said, ‚Äúbecause of being impermanent.‚Äù

original: des na zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu rtsom bar ma nges pas so //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu rtsom bar ma nges pas so //
translated: Therefore, because the effect is not ascertained to be produced,

original: de ni brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de ni brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba'o //
translated: it arises immediately upon the exertion of the cause.

original: rgyu'i zhes bya ba nas bzhin no'i bar ni rtsod pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i zhes bya ba nas bzhin no'i bar ni rtsod pa'o //
translated: The opponent‚Äôs position from ‚Äúthe cause‚Äù up to ‚Äúlike that‚Äù is the objection.

original: 'di la bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di la bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The thought here is as follows.

original: mi rtag pa thams cad ni rdza mkhan la sogs pa rgyu'i rtsol ba'i de ma thag tu 'byung ba'i shes pa skyed pa yin te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa thams cad ni rdza mkhan la sogs pa rgyu'i rtsol ba'i de ma thag tu 'byung ba'i shes pa skyed pa yin te /
translated: All impermanent things generate the cognition of their arising immediately upon the exertion of the cause, such as the potter.

original: des na 'bras bu ni rnam pa gnyis su 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na 'bras bu ni rnam pa gnyis su 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the effect is not twofold.

original: des na ci ltar byas pa nyid kyis me rtag pa nyid khyad par de bzhin du shes pas kyang yin no //
analyzed: des na ci ltar byas pa nyid kyis me rtag pa nyid khyad par de bzhin du shes pas kyang yin no //
translated: Therefore, just as fire is permanent by virtue of its activity, so too is consciousness.

original: des na brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba yang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba yang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, that which arises immediately upon the application of effort is a natural reason.

original: @169b gal te shes pas khyab pa yin pa de lta na yang bum pa la sogs pa ni shes pa las don gzhan nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: @169b gal te shes pas khyab pa yin pa de lta na yang bum pa la sogs pa ni shes pa las don gzhan nyid ma yin nam /
translated: Even if it is pervaded by consciousness, is a pot not something different from consciousness?

original: des na 'od rang bzhin gyi nang du ci ltar bsdu snyam na /
analyzed: des na 'od rang bzhin gyi nang du ci ltar bsdu snyam na /
translated: How then can light be included among the natural elements?

original: ci ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the question.

original: brtsal ma thag tu zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: brtsal ma thag tu zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: The answer is ‚Äújust as.‚Äù

original: brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi shes pa ni /
analyzed: brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi shes pa ni /
translated: The characteristic of consciousness that arises immediately upon the application of effort

original: don rnams kyi yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don rnams kyi yod pa ma yin no //
translated: is not the existence of objects.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: shes pa skyed par byed pa'i don de las gzhan shes pa skyed par mi byed pa rnams med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa skyed par byed pa'i don de las gzhan shes pa skyed par mi byed pa rnams med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that objects that produce consciousness would not produce other consciousnesses.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba'i shes pa'i mtshan nyid yod pa ma yin pas na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba'i shes pa'i mtshan nyid yod pa ma yin pas na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means because the characteristic of the awareness that arises immediately after the effort is not present.

original: brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba 'ga' zhig la rnam par yod pa yod pa ni rjes su 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba 'ga' zhig la rnam par yod pa yod pa ni rjes su 'gro ba'o //
translated: The presence of the awareness that arises immediately after the effort is the positive concomitance.

original: yod pa 'ga' zhig la yang med pa ni ldog pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa 'ga' zhig la yang med pa ni ldog pa'o //
translated: The absence of the awareness that arises immediately after the effort is the negative concomitance.

original: de dag gis brtsigs pa'i tha dad pa gang la yod pa'i shes pa de la de skad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dag gis brtsigs pa'i tha dad pa gang la yod pa'i shes pa de la de skad ces bya ba'o //
translated: The awareness that has the presence of the difference that is constructed by the effort is called that.

original: brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba'i don thams cad ni shes pa skyed par byed pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba'i don thams cad ni shes pa skyed par byed pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Not all objects that arise immediately after the effort produce the awareness,

original: 'on kyang 'ga' zhig kho nas yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'ga' zhig kho nas yin no //
translated: but rather some do.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni brtsigs pa'i tha dad pa yod pas na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni brtsigs pa'i tha dad pa yod pas na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means because the difference that is constructed is present.

original: ci ltar rtogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni 'di yin te /üîΩbrtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba nyid kyis ni /
analyzed: ci ltar rtogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni 'di yin te / brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba nyid kyis ni /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúhow is it understood?‚Äù and so on is as follows.

original: sgra mi rtag pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: sgra mi rtag pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: The fact that it arises immediately after the effort is not the proof that sound is impermanent.

original: de yang 'di las 'grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang 'di las 'grub pa ma yin te /
translated: And that is not established from this.

original: brtsal ma thar tu 'byung ba'i shes pa ni rtag pa dad mi rtag pa'i 'bras bu yin pa nyid kyis ma nges pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: brtsal ma thar tu 'byung ba'i shes pa ni rtag pa dad mi rtag pa'i 'bras bu yin pa nyid kyis ma nges pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The cognition that occurs without effort is indeterminate, because it is the effect of both the permanent and the impermanent.

original: rtsod par byed pas ma nges pa nyid brjod pa ni /
analyzed: rtsod par byed pas ma nges pa nyid brjod pa ni /
translated: The opponent states the indeterminacy:

original: de ltar yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case,‚Äù he says,

original: rigs pa'i mdo byed pas bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: rigs pa'i mdo byed pas bshad pa yin no //
translated: the author of the NyƒÅyamukha explains.

original: rtsol ba'i 'bras bu ni du ma yin te /
analyzed: rtsol ba'i 'bras bu ni du ma yin te /
translated: The effect of effort is manifold,

original: mngon par gsal ba la sogs pa'i dbye bas 'bras bu du ma yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par gsal ba la sogs pa'i dbye bas 'bras bu du ma yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there are many effects due to the distinction of manifestation, etc.

original: de nyid brjod pa ni gsal ba'ang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid brjod pa ni gsal ba'ang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: He states just that: ‚ÄúManifestation, etc.‚Äù

original: rtsol bas ni shes pa ltar byed la res 'ga' ni don kyang yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtsol bas ni shes pa ltar byed la res 'ga' ni don kyang yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that, like cognition, the object is sometimes produced by effort.

original: skyes bu'i mar me 'degs pa'i rtsol ba ni bum ba skyed pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: skyes bu'i mar me 'degs pa'i rtsol ba ni bum ba skyed pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The effort of a person in raising a lamp is not the production of a pot,

original: 'on kyang shes par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang shes par byed pa yin no //
translated: but rather the illumination of it.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case,‚Äù he says,

original: bum pa rdza mkhan gyi 'bras bur sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni skabs las so //
analyzed: bum pa rdza mkhan gyi 'bras bur sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni skabs las so //
translated: The statement ‚Äúthe pot is established as the effect of the potter‚Äù is from the point of view of the context.

original: gnyi ga zhes bya ba ni don dang shes pa'i 'bras bur ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga zhes bya ba ni don dang shes pa'i 'bras bur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBoth‚Äù means the effect of the object and the effect of the consciousness.

original: rnam par bshad pa byed pa ni ri khrod rje'o //
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa byed pa ni ri khrod rje'o //
translated: The author of the commentary is RƒÅhulabhadra.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni rtag par mi 'thad na'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni rtag par mi 'thad na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise,‚Äù means if permanence is not tenable.

original: byed pa'i tha snyad las kyang sgra 'bras bur mi 'grub bo @170a * //
analyzed: byed pa'i tha snyad las kyang sgra 'bras bur mi 'grub bo @170a * //
translated: ‚ÄúAlso, from the convention of the agent, sound is not established as the effect.‚Äù

original: zhes brjod pa ni sgra byed do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes brjod pa ni sgra byed do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement ‚Äúsound is the agent‚Äù is the response.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sbyor pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs par byed pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyor pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs par byed pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because ‚Äúapplication‚Äù and so on have the meaning of the agent.

original: 'o na rtag pa nyid ji ltar 'grub snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na rtag pa nyid ji ltar 'grub snyam na /
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúHow is permanence established?‚Äù

original: sgra rtag pa nyid kyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sgra rtag pa nyid kyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe permanence of sound‚Äù is the response.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni ngo shes pas grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni ngo shes pas grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means because it is established by recognition.

original: glog la sogs pa 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad kyi sgra rtag pa yang ngo //
analyzed: glog la sogs pa 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad kyi sgra rtag pa yang ngo //
translated: Not only lightning and so on, but also sound is permanent.

original: rtsol bas gsal bar bya ba nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: rtsol bas gsal bar bya ba nyid yin gyi /
translated: It is manifested by effort.

original: bskyed par bya ba ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bskyed par bya ba ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not something that is produced.

original: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
analyzed: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: mar me las bum pa gsal ba de bzhin no //
analyzed: mar me las bum pa gsal ba de bzhin no //
translated: Like a pot that is manifested by a lamp.

original: mngon par gsal ba 'di gang gi yin zhing /
analyzed: mngon par gsal ba 'di gang gi yin zhing /
translated: What is manifested?

original: mtshan nyid kyang ci lta bu zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyang ci lta bu zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is its characteristic?

original: rtag pa nyid kyi dang dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du ni bum pa'i dpes grub po zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: rtag pa nyid kyi dang dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du ni bum pa'i dpes grub po zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: It is said that the example of the pot establishes that the self is permanent and has the characteristic of being perceived.

original: de dang de min zhes bya ba dmigs pa dang ma dmigs pa'i dus dag dang ldan par yod par bum pa ngo shes pa'i tshad mas grub pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: de dang de min zhes bya ba dmigs pa dang ma dmigs pa'i dus dag dang ldan par yod par bum pa ngo shes pa'i tshad mas grub pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: That which is established by the valid cognition of the recognition of the pot as existing in the states of being perceived and not being perceived, as in the statement ‚ÄúIt is not this or that,‚Äù

original: yang zhes bya ba phyis dmigs pa ni mngon par gsal ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba phyis dmigs pa ni mngon par gsal ba zhes brjod do //
translated: is said to be manifested later, at the time of being perceived again.

original: ci'i phyir de nyid gsal ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de nyid gsal ba yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it manifested?

original: gang gi phyir nye bar dmigs pa las gsal ba'i mtshan nyid gzhan ni ste rang gi ngo bo yod pa ma yin te des na de nyid gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir nye bar dmigs pa las gsal ba'i mtshan nyid gzhan ni ste rang gi ngo bo yod pa ma yin te des na de nyid gsal ba yin no //
translated: Because apart from being perceived, there is no other characteristic of existence, of its own nature. Therefore, it is manifested.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba dmigs pa dang ma dmigs pa'i dus dag tu yod par grub pa yin na /
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba dmigs pa dang ma dmigs pa'i dus dag tu yod par grub pa yin na /
translated: ‚ÄúSo too‚Äù means that if it is established that it exists at the time of the apprehension of the object and at the time of the nonapprehension of the object,

original: bum ba sngar yod pa mar me bteg pa la sogs pa'i rkyen 'ga' zhig la nye bar dmigs par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: bum ba sngar yod pa mar me bteg pa la sogs pa'i rkyen 'ga' zhig la nye bar dmigs par 'gyur gyi /
translated: then the previously existent pot would be the effect of the conditions of raising the lamp, and so on.

original: sngar yod pa'i bum pa 'bras bu nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sngar yod pa'i bum pa 'bras bu nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: But the previously existent pot is not the effect of the lamp.

original: don la sbyar ba ni de bzhin zhes bya ba brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba'i rnam par shes pa yod kyang sgra'i 'bras bu ma yin no //
analyzed: don la sbyar ba ni de bzhin zhes bya ba brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba'i rnam par shes pa yod kyang sgra'i 'bras bu ma yin no //
translated: The meaning of the example is as follows: ‚ÄúSo too‚Äù means that even though the consciousness that arises immediately after the effort is present, it is not the effect of the sound.

original: gal te sgra rtag pa nyid yin na de'i tshe sgra sngar yod pa'i shes pa ni /
analyzed: gal te sgra rtag pa nyid yin na de'i tshe sgra sngar yod pa'i shes pa ni /
translated: If the sound were permanent, then the consciousness of the sound that existed previously

original: brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba kho nar nges par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba kho nar nges par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: would not definitely arise immediately after the effort.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sgrib byed dang dbang po dang sgra rnams la rtsol bde rnam pa thams cad du ci yang mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrib byed dang dbang po dang sgra rnams la rtsol bde rnam pa thams cad du ci yang mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the effort does not do anything at all to the obscuring object, the sense faculty, or the sound.

original: sun 'byin pa 'di yang rtsol pas gsal ba nyid khas blangs nas brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: sun 'byin pa 'di yang rtsol pas gsal ba nyid khas blangs nas brjod pa yin te /
translated: This refutation is stated on the assumption that the manifestation of the sound is accepted.

original: 'di ni rtsol bas gsal bar byas pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni rtsol bas gsal bar byas pa yang ma yin te /
translated: This is not a manifestation that is produced by effort.

original: 'on kyang rtsol ba'i 'bras bu kho na'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang rtsol ba'i 'bras bu kho na'o //
translated: However, it is only the result of effort.

original: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
analyzed: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: dper na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: For example,

original: rdza mkhan gyi rtsol bas zhes bya ba ni grangs can gyi lugs dgag pa'o //
analyzed: rdza mkhan gyi rtsol bas zhes bya ba ni grangs can gyi lugs dgag pa'o //
translated: the effort of the potter, etc.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rgyu'i tshogs zhes bya ba'i @170b mngon par gsal bar byed pa'i phyir rgyu rnams don med pa ma yin no snyam na /
analyzed: rgyu'i tshogs zhes bya ba'i @170b mngon par gsal bar byed pa'i phyir rgyu rnams don med pa ma yin no snyam na /
translated: If you think that the collection of causes is not meaningless because it produces manifestation,üîΩeverything

original: thams cad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba'o //
translated: is the cause of everything.

original: dogs pa ni rgyu rnams zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dogs pa ni rgyu rnams zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The doubt is that the causes are the cause of the manifestation of the effect.

original: 'jim gong la ni bum pa kho na'i shing ni ma yin no zhes bya bar nges pa'o //
analyzed: 'jim gong la ni bum pa kho na'i shing ni ma yin no zhes bya bar nges pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that the pot is not the effect of the lump of clay, and the cloth is not the effect of the threads.üîΩIf it were not so,

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba byed pa po la mi ltos na'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba byed pa po la mi ltos na'o //
translated: if it were not the case that the effect is not seen prior to its production,üîΩthe ascertainment

original: nges pa zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: nges pa zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: is the philosophical theory.

original: byed pa pos byas pa gang yin pa'i nges pa de ni med pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byed pa pos byas pa gang yin pa'i nges pa de ni med pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the ascertainment that the effect is produced by the agent is completely nonexistent.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThus‚Äù means in that way.

original: rdza mkhan gyis 'jim gong la shing la sogs pa bzlog par bya ba la ma gtogs par ni /
analyzed: rdza mkhan gyis 'jim gong la shing la sogs pa bzlog par bya ba la ma gtogs par ni /
translated: The potter does not make the pot alone, except for the purpose of excluding the stick, etc. from the lump of clay.

original: bum pa kho na byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa de lta bu'i rang bzhin gyi nges pa zhes bya ba yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bum pa kho na byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa de lta bu'i rang bzhin gyi nges pa zhes bya ba yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: There is no such thing as a nature that is definite in that way.

original: 'on kyang rnam pa 'di 'dra ba'i nges pa ni /
analyzed: 'on kyang rnam pa 'di 'dra ba'i nges pa ni /
translated: However, a definite exclusion of that sort

original: gzhan bzlog pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: gzhan bzlog pa kho na yin no //
translated: is just the exclusion of another.

original: rnam pa 'di 'dra ba kho nar nges par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa 'di 'dra ba kho nar nges par byed do zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is definite in just that way,

original: yod pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yod pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: then it is said to exist.

original: thams cad thams cad la yod do zhes bas blangs pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: thams cad thams cad la yod do zhes bas blangs pa'i phyir na /
translated: Because it is accepted that everything exists in everything,

original: 'jam gong la shing la sogs pa yod pa ni rdza mkhan la sogs pas kyang bzlog par mi nus te /
analyzed: 'jam gong la shing la sogs pa yod pa ni rdza mkhan la sogs pas kyang bzlog par mi nus te /
translated: the stick, etc. exist in the lump of clay, and the potter, etc. cannot exclude them,

original: 'jim pa'i rgyu mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jim pa'i rgyu mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the cause of clay is not suitable.

original: yang na bzlog med de lta na yang nyes pa yod pa kho na'o zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: yang na bzlog med de lta na yang nyes pa yod pa kho na'o zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: Or, even if they cannot be excluded, it is said that there is still a fault.

original: bzlog pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bzlog pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is expressed by ‚Äúexclusion. ‚Äù

original: gal te rdza mkhan la sogs pas 'jim gong la shing la sogs pa bzlog pa med par byed pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te rdza mkhan la sogs pas 'jim gong la shing la sogs pa bzlog pa med par byed pa yin na /
translated: were to make the lump of clay without removing the tree, etc.,

original: de'i tshe ljon pa la sogs pa yod pa ma yin pa de yang phyis rtogs par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i tshe ljon pa la sogs pa yod pa ma yin pa de yang phyis rtogs par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: then how could the non-existence of the tree, etc. be later understood?üîΩAccording to the Samkhya, at one time the lump of clay, which is the nature of the pot, later becomes the nature of the tree, etc.

original: grangs can gyi ltar na ni dus gcig gi tshe bum pa'i rang bzhin yongs su gyur pa'i 'jim gong nyid gzhan gyi tshe ljon pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du 'gro ba yin zhes bya ba lugs yin no //
analyzed: grangs can gyi ltar na ni dus gcig gi tshe bum pa'i rang bzhin yongs su gyur pa'i 'jim gong nyid gzhan gyi tshe ljon pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du 'gro ba yin zhes bya ba lugs yin no //
translated: That is their system.

original: de yang bum pa skyed pa'i tshe log pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang bum pa skyed pa'i tshe log pa'i phyir /
translated: But since the pot is produced,

original: phyis yang rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyis yang rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: it will not be understood later.

original: med pa kho na las phyis dmigs par 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: med pa kho na las phyis dmigs par 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is said that it is only non-existent that is later observed,

original: yod pa ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is said that it does not exist.

original: skye ba kho na'i gsal ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skye ba kho na'i gsal ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not only the manifestation of arising.

original: 'bras bu yod par smra ba'i 'dod pa la ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu yod par smra ba'i 'dod pa la ni /
translated: As for the assertion of the existence of the effect,

original: sgra nges par 'byed pa yang mi 'thad de nges pa nyid kyang yod pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: sgra nges par 'byed pa yang mi 'thad de nges pa nyid kyang yod pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: It is not tenable that sound is differentiated, because of the very existence of differentiation.

original: 'bras bu snga ma zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu snga ma zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The former effect is called ‚Äúexistence.‚Äù

original: des na zhes bya ba ni yod pas na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni yod pas na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means because of existence.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni myu gu 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi nges pa yang ngo //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni myu gu 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi nges pa yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers not only to the sprout, but also to differentiation.

original: yod de zhes bya ba ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: yod de zhes bya ba ni nges pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúExists‚Äù refers to differentiation.

original: lan ni gal te de yang zhes bya ba ste mngon @171a * //üîΩpar gsal ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni gal te de yang zhes bya ba ste mngon @171a * // par gsal ba'o //
translated: The response is ‚ÄúIf that‚Äù which is the manifestation.

original: de la ni mngon par gsal ba la'o //üîΩ'o na gnyi ga dang ldan pa byed do zhe na /
analyzed: de la ni mngon par gsal ba la'o // 'o na gnyi ga dang ldan pa byed do zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúIn that‚Äù refers to the manifestation.üîΩ‚ÄúBoth‚Äù refers to the existence and nonexistence of the effect.

original: yod ba dang med ba nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: yod ba dang med ba nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúExistence and nonexistence‚Äù is the response.

original: brjod zin pa'i don nyid sdud pa ni /
analyzed: brjod zin pa'i don nyid sdud pa ni /
translated: The summary of the very meaning that has been expressed is ‚ÄúIf it exists.‚Äù

original: yin na bstan du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yin na bstan du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is taught‚Äù is the summary.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni byed pa po'i tshogs don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni byed pa po'i tshogs don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means because the collection of agents is meaningless.

original: bum pa rtsol bas gsal bar bya ba ma yin mod /
analyzed: bum pa rtsol bas gsal bar bya ba ma yin mod /
translated: A pot is not something that is manifested through effort.

original: mar me gsal bar bya ba ni yin no //
analyzed: mar me gsal bar bya ba ni yin no //
translated: A lamp is something that is manifested.

original: de bzhin du sgra yang rtsol bas gsal bar bya bar 'gyur ro zhes dogs par byed pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra yang rtsol bas gsal bar bya bar 'gyur ro zhes dogs par byed pa ni /
translated: Likewise, sound is also something that is manifested through effort.

original: 'on ci ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on ci ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: How is that?

original: lan ni bum ba ltar sgra ni gsal bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: lan ni bum ba ltar sgra ni gsal bar bya ba yin no //
translated: The answer is: Sound is manifested like a pot.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bum pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bum pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because of the existence of the pot.

original: sngar ni mar me la sogs pa yod pa'i sngon rol du'o //
analyzed: sngar ni mar me la sogs pa yod pa'i sngon rol du'o //
translated: Previously, prior to the existence of the lamp, etc.

original: tshad ma reg pa la sogs pa'i yul can gyi shes pa yod ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma reg pa la sogs pa'i yul can gyi shes pa yod ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the existence of the cognition that has as its object the valid cognition of contact, etc.

original: sgra la yang rtsol ba las sngar yod pa la ngo shes pa'i tshad ma yod de zhes dogs par byed pa ni /
analyzed: sgra la yang rtsol ba las sngar yod pa la ngo shes pa'i tshad ma yod de zhes dogs par byed pa ni /
translated: Sound also exists prior to effort, because there is the valid cognition of recognition.

original: 'di la yang zhes bya ba ste sgra la yang ngo //
analyzed: 'di la yang zhes bya ba ste sgra la yang ngo //
translated: Here also means in regard to sound.

original: shes pa gnyis kyi zhes bya ba ni shes zin pa dang shes bzhin pa gnyis kyi dbus na yod pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa gnyis kyi zhes bya ba ni shes zin pa dang shes bzhin pa gnyis kyi dbus na yod pa'o //
translated: The two cognitions are the one that has already cognized and the one that is in the process of cognizing.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni shes pa la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni shes pa la'o //
translated: In that, i.e., in the cognition.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'o //
translated: If, i.e., the opponent says.

original: de zhes bya bas ra mthong ba'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya bas ra mthong ba'o //
translated: That, i.e., the sound.

original: lan ni de ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni de ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is: ‚ÄúThat is not so.‚Äù

original: dbang skyes nyid ma yin zhes bya ba ni dran pa nyid do //üîΩgal te de lta yin mod /
analyzed: dbang skyes nyid ma yin zhes bya ba ni dran pa nyid do // gal te de lta yin mod /
translated: ‚ÄúNot born of the senses‚Äù means not born of memory.

original: de ltan yang ci ltar tshad ma ma yin zhe na dbang skyes dran ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltan yang ci ltar tshad ma ma yin zhe na dbang skyes dran ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEven if that is so,‚Äù one might say, ‚Äúhow is it not a valid cognition?‚Äù The answer is: ‚ÄúBorn of the senses, memory.‚Äù

original: des na zhes bya ba ni shes pa gzhan med pas na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni shes pa gzhan med pas na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means because there is no other cognition.

original: dbang skyes ma yin pa'i phyir dran pa ste ngo shes pa ni tshad ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: dbang skyes ma yin pa'i phyir dran pa ste ngo shes pa ni tshad ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Memory, or recognition, is a valid cognition because it is not born of the senses.

original: ci ltar dbang skyes nyid min zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar dbang skyes nyid min zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúHow is it not born of the senses?‚Äù

original: dbang bo rnams ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dbang bo rnams ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe senses‚Äù means the five sense organs.

original: gzhan du na zhes bya ba ni 'jug na'o //
analyzed: gzhan du na zhes bya ba ni 'jug na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù means if they were to engage.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni dran bar bya ba yin pas na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni dran bar bya ba yin pas na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means because it is what is remembered.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni rtsod ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni rtsod ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBut,‚Äù one might say, ‚Äúif that is so,‚Äù this is a dispute.

original: lan ni ngo mthong bzhin pa la yang shes pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni ngo mthong bzhin pa la yang shes pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is: ‚ÄúBecause it is known even when seeing is present.‚Äù

original: dogs pa ni dran ba dang lhan cig mthong bzhin ba gcig tu rtogs pa la'o //
analyzed: dogs pa ni dran ba dang lhan cig mthong bzhin ba gcig tu rtogs pa la'o //
translated: The doubt is that memory and seeing are realized as one.

original: de zhes bya ba ni dran pas gzhal ba'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni dran pas gzhal ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the object of memory.

original: gal te dran pas tshad ma ma yin pas /
analyzed: gal te dran pas tshad ma ma yin pas /
translated: If memory is not a valid cognition,

original: dran bar bya ba'i chos can mi bden pa nyid yin yang de'i gcig nyid ci ltar mi bden zhe na /
analyzed: dran bar bya ba'i chos can mi bden pa nyid yin yang de'i gcig nyid ci ltar mi bden zhe na /
translated: then even though the subject of memory is false, why is its singularity not false?

original: chos can zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: chos can zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSubject‚Äù is what is being referred to.

original: gal te sngar gyi dus dang 'brel pa ni dran pas rtogs pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te sngar gyi dus dang 'brel pa ni dran pas rtogs pa ma yin gyi /
translated: If the connection to the past is not understood through memory,

original: 'on kyang mngon sum gyis yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang mngon sum gyis yin no //
translated: but rather through direct perception,

original: des na de'i gcig nyid ci @171b ltar mi bden snyam na /
analyzed: des na de'i gcig nyid ci @171b ltar mi bden snyam na /
translated: then why is its singularity not false?

original: snga ma'i dus dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: snga ma'i dus dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúConnection to the past‚Äù is what is being referred to.üîΩIf the connection to the past is not understood through memory, but rather through direct perception,

original: gal te sngon gyi dus dang 'brel ba bzhin du rang bzhin ci snang ba yang dran pa kho nas rtogs pa ma yin na ma zhe na /
analyzed: gal te sngon gyi dus dang 'brel ba bzhin du rang bzhin ci snang ba yang dran pa kho nas rtogs pa ma yin na ma zhe na /
translated: then why is its singularity not false?

original: dngos po tsam zhig ces gsungs so //
analyzed: dngos po tsam zhig ces gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúMere thing‚Äù is what is being referred to.

original: ci ltar ngo shes pa med kyang rtogs she na /
analyzed: ci ltar ngo shes pa med kyang rtogs she na /
translated: How is it understood even without recognition?

original: dkar po dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dkar po dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhite‚Äù is what is being referred to.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: dang por zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dang por zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFirst‚Äù is what is being referred to.

original: de zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin tsam snang ba'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin tsam snang ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the mere appearance of the nature.

original: dang por mthong pa ni sngon por nges kyi /
analyzed: dang por mthong pa ni sngon por nges kyi /
translated: The first perception is of the blue color,

original: rtag pa nyid du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid du ni ma yin no //
translated: but not of permanence.

original: pha rol bo'i gzhung gis kyang gnyis pa la sogs pa mthong ba kho na'i tshe rtag pa nyid du snang ba yin no //
analyzed: pha rol bo'i gzhung gis kyang gnyis pa la sogs pa mthong ba kho na'i tshe rtag pa nyid du snang ba yin no //
translated: And by the opponent‚Äôs theory, permanence would be perceived at the time of the second and subsequent perceptions.

original: de la yang zhes bya ba ni dang po snang ba la yang ngo //
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba ni dang po snang ba la yang ngo //
translated: ‚Äú And in that‚Äù means in the first perception.

original: gal te mngon sum gyi bkag pa ji ltar snang zhen /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum gyi bkag pa ji ltar snang zhen /
translated: How is the negation of permanence by perception to be understood?

original: mngon sum gyis ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú By perception‚Äù means by the perception of the blue color.

original: de ni rtag pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ni rtag pa nyid do //
translated: That is permanence.

original: lan ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is ‚ÄúIf it were so. ‚Äù

original: dus kyi cha thams cad dmigs pa de ltar gyur na'o //
analyzed: dus kyi cha thams cad dmigs pa de ltar gyur na'o //
translated: If it were so, if all parts of time were perceived.

original: 'di'i bar gyi dngos po tsam zhig snang ba ni zhes bya ba bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i bar gyi dngos po tsam zhig snang ba ni zhes bya ba bshad pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúonly the thing itself is perceived‚Äù is explained.

original: mjug bsdu ba'i sgo nas snga ma'i dus dang 'brel pa ni zhes bya ba rnam par 'grel pa ni /üîΩde'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba'i sgo nas snga ma'i dus dang 'brel pa ni zhes bya ba rnam par 'grel pa ni / de'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The connection with the previous section is by way of conclusion. ‚Äú Is‚Äù is explained as follows.

original: shi ba'i mthar thug pa 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shi ba'i mthar thug pa 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äú Therefore‚Äù means because it grasps the end of death.

original: dran pa tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rnam par 'grel pa ni /
analyzed: dran pa tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rnam par 'grel pa ni /
translated: because memory is not a valid means of knowledge.

original: des na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚Äú Therefore‚Äù means:

original: sngon gyi dus kyi dngos po dmigs pa ma yin pas na'o //üîΩchos can bden ba ma yin na zhes bya ba rnam par 'grel pa ni /
analyzed: sngon gyi dus kyi dngos po dmigs pa ma yin pas na'o // chos can bden ba ma yin na zhes bya ba rnam par 'grel pa ni /
translated: because the entity of the past is not perceived.üîΩ‚Äú If the subject is not true‚Äù is explained as:

original: chos can mi bden na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: chos can mi bden na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú if the subject is not real.

original: gal te snga ma dang phyi ma dag gi gcig pa nyid mi bden no zhes bya ba ni mi 'thad pa kho na ste /
analyzed: gal te snga ma dang phyi ma dag gi gcig pa nyid mi bden no zhes bya ba ni mi 'thad pa kho na ste /
translated: ‚Äù If it is not tenable that the sameness of the former and the latter is not real,üîΩthen, because they are real and unreal, sameness would also be real and unreal.

original: de dag bden pa dang mi bden pas na gcig nyid kyang bden pa dang mi bden par 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dag bden pa dang mi bden pas na gcig nyid kyang bden pa dang mi bden par 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú But if‚Äù is a doubt.

original: snga ma ni dran par bya ba'o //
analyzed: snga ma ni dran par bya ba'o //
translated: The former is what is remembered.

original: bden pa dang zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'grel pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa dang zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'grel pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Real and unreal‚Äù is the explanation.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni lan 'debs pa'o //
