translated: Is there any such thing as seeing in that way?

original: mar me zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mar me zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúLamp‚Äù is said.

original: sngar cher 'bad nas de'i 'og tu 'ching ba dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: sngar cher 'bad nas de'i 'og tu 'ching ba dang 'dra'o //
translated: It is like a rope that is first greatly strained and then relaxed.

original: ci ltar na mar me dang 'dra bar ngo shes par smra ba rnams drung kho nar rtogs kyis lhung zhen /
analyzed: ci ltar na mar me dang 'dra bar ngo shes par smra ba rnams drung kho nar rtogs kyis lhung zhen /
translated: How is it that those who speak of recognition as being like a lamp realize it only in front of themselves, and not in the case of falling hairs?

original: 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúIn this way‚Äù is said.

original: gal te da lta ba'i dran pa nyams su myong ba'i don 'dzin ba yod na de'i tshe yul zhig pa la ste 'das ba la ci ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te da lta ba'i dran pa nyams su myong ba'i don 'dzin ba yod na de'i tshe yul zhig pa la ste 'das ba la ci ltar 'gyur te /
translated: If the present memory were to apprehend the object of the experience, then how could it be the case that the object has ceased, that is, has become past?

original: nye bar gnas pa kho na nyams su myong ba'i phyir da ltar ba kho na @173b dran pa'i yul yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nye bar gnas pa kho na nyams su myong ba'i phyir da ltar ba kho na @173b dran pa'i yul yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because only that which is present is experienced, the object of memory would be only the present.

original: gal te nyams su myong ba'i don gyi yul can du khas mi len na de'i tshe de ni ci ltar dran pa yin te ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gal te nyams su myong ba'i don gyi yul can du khas mi len na de'i tshe de ni ci ltar dran pa yin te ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: If you do not accept that the object of experience is the object of memory, then how could it be memory? It could not be!

original: rnam par 'grel pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'grel pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The commentary states:

original: gal te dran pa nyams su myong ba'i don mngon du byed pa'i rang bzhin can yin na /
analyzed: gal te dran pa nyams su myong ba'i don mngon du byed pa'i rang bzhin can yin na /
translated: If memory were by nature the manifestation of the object of experience,

original: de'i tshe 'das pa'i don dran par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'das pa'i don dran par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would not be a memory of a past object.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: gang gis phyir 'das pa nyed na mngon sum gyis gang du yang rtogs pa med do //
analyzed: gang gis phyir 'das pa nyed na mngon sum gyis gang du yang rtogs pa med do //
translated: Because the past object is not perceived by direct perception.

original: dran pa yul dang bcas pas na mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin na /
analyzed: dran pa yul dang bcas pas na mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin na /
translated: If memory were a valid cognition of direct perception, then it would have an object that is present.

original: mngon sum ni 'das pa'i yul can ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum ni 'das pa'i yul can ma yin no //
translated: Perception does not have a past object.

original: yang na 'di ni nyes pa gzhan yin te /
analyzed: yang na 'di ni nyes pa gzhan yin te /
translated: Or, this is another fault:

original: dran pa'i gzung ba'i don las skye ba yin na /
analyzed: dran pa'i gzung ba'i don las skye ba yin na /
translated: If it arises from the object grasped by memory,

original: 'das pa nyid ni mngon sum gyis 'dzin pa ma yin no //üîΩmyong min zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: 'das pa nyid ni mngon sum gyis 'dzin pa ma yin no // myong min zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: the past itself is not grasped by perception.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par 'grel pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par 'grel pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Not experienced‚Äù and so on is explained by ‚ÄúIf it is said‚Äù and so on.

original: de lta na yang zhes bya ba ni snga na med pa'i don gyi yul can nyid yin yang ngo //
analyzed: de lta na yang zhes bya ba ni snga na med pa'i don gyi yul can nyid yin yang ngo //
translated: ‚Äú Even so‚Äù means even if it has an object that did not exist previously.

original: snga na med pa'i yul can yin yang ngo shes pa ma yin pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: snga na med pa'i yul can yin yang ngo shes pa ma yin pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Even if it has a previous object, why is it not recognition?

original: ngo shes pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ngo shes pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú Recognition‚Äù and so on.

original: de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ni rtsod pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ni rtsod pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú That itself‚Äù and so on is the objection.

original: gang tshe zhes bya ba da ltar ba'i dus na snga ma'i rang bzhin 'das par 'gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: gang tshe zhes bya ba da ltar ba'i dus na snga ma'i rang bzhin 'das par 'gyur pa yin no //
translated: ‚Äú When‚Äù means when the nature of the past is in the present.

original: de'i tshe zhes bya ba 'das ba ni gzung ba min no //
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya ba 'das ba ni gzung ba min no //
translated: ‚Äú At that time‚Äù means the past is not grasped.

original: gzung ba'i tshe zhes bya ba rang gi dus na ni /
analyzed: gzung ba'i tshe zhes bya ba rang gi dus na ni /
translated: ‚Äú When it is grasped‚Äù means at its own time.

original: gzung ba ni de ltar zhes bya ba 'das pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: gzung ba ni de ltar zhes bya ba 'das pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: The object is not like that, i.e., it is not past.

original: ci ltar gzung ba 'das pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar gzung ba 'das pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is the object not past?

original: dran par gyur pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dran par gyur pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is that which has become memory.

original: gal te zhes bya ba nas zhe na'i bar ni rtsod pa'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba nas zhe na'i bar ni rtsod pa'o //
translated: The argument from ‚ÄúIf‚Äù up to ‚Äúit is not tenable‚Äù is the objection.

original: gal te 'jig rten na nges pa bstan pa'i phyir tshad mar rigs pas 'thad pa yin na de'i tshe ngo shes pa yang der 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'jig rten na nges pa bstan pa'i phyir tshad mar rigs pas 'thad pa yin na de'i tshe ngo shes pa yang der 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is tenable that perception is valid because it reveals what is certain in the world, then recognition would also be that.

original: 'on te 'das pa la dbang po dang ldan pa med pa des na ngo shes pa tshad ma ma yin par brjod na zhes dogs pa bsu nas brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'on te 'das pa la dbang po dang ldan pa med pa des na ngo shes pa tshad ma ma yin par brjod na zhes dogs pa bsu nas brjod pa ni /
translated: But if you say that recognition is not valid because it does not have a present sense faculty, then in response to this qualm he says:

original: dbang po dang ldan pa don med nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po dang ldan pa don med nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: It is meaningless to have a sense faculty.

original: 'di ltar des par bstan pa kho nas tshad ma ma yin na dbang po dang ldan pa brtags /
analyzed: 'di ltar des par bstan pa kho nas tshad ma ma yin na dbang po dang ldan pa brtags /
translated: If it is not valid just because it reveals what is certain, then what is the use of a sense faculty?

original: ci mi mgo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ci mi mgo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: What is the meaning of ‚Äúhead‚Äù?

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam par 'grel pa'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam par 'grel pa'o //
translated: The commentary on ‚ÄúIf‚Äù and so on is:

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan no //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan no //
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúThis‚Äù and so on.

original: ci ltar mi bzod snyam du zad snyam na /
analyzed: ci ltar mi bzod snyam du zad snyam na /
translated: If one thinks that it is not possible to be deceived, because it is exhausted,

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: it is like this.

original: mi lta ba dang ldan pa las ni yin gyi bskrun pa las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mi lta ba dang ldan pa las ni yin gyi bskrun pa las ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not from the production of the object that one is deceived, but from the perception of the object.

original: gang la de nyid 'di yin no snyam na sa zhugs ba der ni da ltar ba la mi slu ba @174a * //
analyzed: gang la de nyid 'di yin no snyam na sa zhugs ba der ni da ltar ba la mi slu ba @174a * //
translated: If one thinks that the object is just as it is perceived, then it is not deceptive in the present,

original: yod kyi 'das pa la ma yin no //üîΩ'on te gcig med par ni /
analyzed: yod kyi 'das pa la ma yin no // 'on te gcig med par ni /
translated: but it is deceptive in the past.

original: mi slu ba nyid mi rung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: mi slu ba nyid mi rung ngo zhe na /
translated: But if one thinks that it is not possible for it to be deceptive unless it is one,

original: gal te zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ste /
translated: then it is like this.

original: snga ma dang / phyi ma de dag gcig nyid min mod /
analyzed: snga ma dang / phyi ma de dag gcig nyid min mod /
translated: The former and the latter are not one.

original: ci de'i tshe gcig nyid dang bral ba'i don de las don bya ba de min par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: ci de'i tshe gcig nyid dang bral ba'i don de las don bya ba de min par 'gyur ram /
translated: But is it not the case that at that time the object, which is devoid of oneness, is not the object of activity?

original: gcig med kyang mi slu bar 'gyur ba kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gcig med kyang mi slu bar 'gyur ba kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not the case that the object of activity is not the object, but it is deceptive.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it deceptive?

original: me zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: me zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is like fire.

original: skad cig gzhan du gyur pa'i mes so //
analyzed: skad cig gzhan du gyur pa'i mes so //
translated: The fire that is a different moment from the previous fire.

original: 'o na ci ltar gcig go zhes bya ba'i tha snyad du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar gcig go zhes bya ba'i tha snyad du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But how can it be conventionally called one?

original: de mi byed pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de mi byed pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is not that it does not perform the function of fire.

original: don bya ba dang bral ba'i don /
analyzed: don bya ba dang bral ba'i don /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúobject‚Äù is the absence of activity.

original: don dam pa pa'i gcig nyid kyi mtshan nyid du gyur ba'i yul gang dag la yod pa de dag la de skad ces brjod do //
analyzed: don dam pa pa'i gcig nyid kyi mtshan nyid du gyur ba'i yul gang dag la yod pa de dag la de skad ces brjod do //
translated: Those that exist as objects of the characteristic of ultimate oneness are said to be that way.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni gus par bya ba ma yin pas na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni gus par bya ba ma yin pas na'o //
translated: ‚Äú Therefore‚Äù means because of the lack of respect.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin ba des na don bya ba byed pa nyid de'i rang bzhin gyi rtags gang la yod pa'i ngo shes pa de ni rjes su dpag pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin ba des na don bya ba byed pa nyid de'i rang bzhin gyi rtags gang la yod pa'i ngo shes pa de ni rjes su dpag pa yin no //
translated: Since that is so, the inference is that which has as its sign the nature of the performance of activity.

original: rang bzhin don bya ba byed pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin don bya ba byed pa'o //
translated: The nature is the performance of activity.

original: de las gzhan zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa gcig pa nyid las so //üîΩ'o na zhes bya ba ni gal te rgyu gcig la du ma yin yang ngo shes pa ngo shes pa yin na de'i tshe du mar gyur pa'i bum pa dus mnyam pa na yod ba'am /
analyzed: de las gzhan zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa gcig pa nyid las so // 'o na zhes bya ba ni gal te rgyu gcig la du ma yin yang ngo shes pa ngo shes pa yin na de'i tshe du mar gyur pa'i bum pa dus mnyam pa na yod ba'am /
translated: ‚Äú Other than that‚Äù means other than the oneness of apprehension.

original: dus thams cad yod pa la yang ngo shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dus thams cad yod pa la yang ngo shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚Äú But‚Äù means if, although there are many causes, there is recognition, then at that time there would be recognition of the pot that is multiple, existing at the same time, or existing at all times.

original: ngo shes pa'i rnam pa brjod pa ni de nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ngo shes pa'i rnam pa brjod pa ni de nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: The expression of the form of recognition is ‚Äúthat itself.‚Äù

original: de dang zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: de dang zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù is the reply.

original: ngo shes pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: ngo shes pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Recognition is of two kinds:

original: gcig na de dang mtshungs so snyam pa'i rnam pa can yin la /
analyzed: gcig na de dang mtshungs so snyam pa'i rnam pa can yin la /
translated: one is of the form ‚Äúit is similar to that,‚Äù

original: gzhan de nyid 'di'o zhes bya ba'o rnam pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan de nyid 'di'o zhes bya ba'o rnam pa'o //
translated: and the other is of the form ‚Äúthat is this.‚Äù

original: de la chu 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i bya ba byed pa nyid kyis 'di ni bum pa gzhan dang mtshungs pa'i rnam ba'o zhes bya bar rtogs pa nyid ngo shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de la chu 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i bya ba byed pa nyid kyis 'di ni bum pa gzhan dang mtshungs pa'i rnam ba'o zhes bya bar rtogs pa nyid ngo shes pa yin no //
translated: In the case of the cognition of the water-bearer, etc., the cognition ‚Äúthis is similar to that pot‚Äù is recognition.

original: gnyis par yang 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis par yang 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAlso‚Äù means ‚Äúfurthermore.‚Äù

original: gal te bum pa rnams rgyud tha dad pa nyid du 'gyur na ci ltar bum pa de nyid 'di yin no zhes ngo shes snyam na 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te bum pa rnams rgyud tha dad pa nyid du 'gyur na ci ltar bum pa de nyid 'di yin no zhes ngo shes snyam na 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If the pots are different streams, how can there be recognition of the form ‚Äúthat pot is this pot‚Äù?

original: gzhan ni bum pa las gzhan par rigs mi mthun pa'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan ni bum pa las gzhan par rigs mi mthun pa'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúOther‚Äù means a thing of a different class from the pot.

original: de gsal gzhan ni bum pa las gzhan pa'i bum pa'o //
analyzed: de gsal gzhan ni bum pa las gzhan pa'i bum pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAnother‚Äù means a pot that is different from the pot.

original: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam par 'grel pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam par 'grel pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhen‚Äù and so on is the commentary.

original: gal te don dam pa pa'i gcig nyid med par ngo shes pa ni nye bar brtags pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te don dam pa pa'i gcig nyid med par ngo shes pa ni nye bar brtags pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that recognition is a mere postulation because there is no ultimate identity,

original: thog ma med pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then it is said that there is no beginning.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ngo shes kyi rtogs pa ma nges pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ngo shes kyi rtogs pa ma nges pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore means because the understanding of recognition is uncertain.

original: gal te nges @174b pa yod pas ci ltar bsnyon snyam na /
analyzed: gal te nges @174b pa yod pas ci ltar bsnyon snyam na /
translated: If you think that since there is certainty, why deny it,

original: sgra rnams kyi rtogs par byed ba'i nus pa mtshungs pa'i phyir na de ltar gcig nyid du 'khrul ba'i nges pa byung ba na mi bsnyon pa yin no //
analyzed: sgra rnams kyi rtogs par byed ba'i nus pa mtshungs pa'i phyir na de ltar gcig nyid du 'khrul ba'i nges pa byung ba na mi bsnyon pa yin no //
translated: it is because the power of understanding of words is the same. Thus, when the certainty of error as identity arises, it is undeniable.

original: des na gal te yang ngo shes pa tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir na sgra gcig ba nyid mi 'grub pa de lta na yang brtags pa'i gcig nyid kyis rjod par byed pa nyid du ni grub pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des na gal te yang ngo shes pa tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir na sgra gcig ba nyid mi 'grub pa de lta na yang brtags pa'i gcig nyid kyis rjod par byed pa nyid du ni grub pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, even if recognition is not established as the identity of a single word because it is not valid cognition, still, by the postulation of identity, it is established as the expressive.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni gal te skad cig nyid kyis ni gzhan yin na /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni gal te skad cig nyid kyis ni gzhan yin na /
translated: If means if, by momentariness, it is different.

original: de'i tshe skad cig gzhan du ste gzhan la de nyid 'di yin no snyam pa'i yid ches pa ci ltar 'jug par 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i tshe skad cig gzhan du ste gzhan la de nyid 'di yin no snyam pa'i yid ches pa ci ltar 'jug par 'gyur /
translated: How could there be any confidence in the thought that this is the same at another moment, at another time?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: shes ba med pa zhes bya ba'o /
analyzed: shes ba med pa zhes bya ba'o /
translated: Because there is no cognition.

original: 'khrul pa zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: 'khrul pa zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: The answer is: because of error.

original: khyod kyis bsam pas skad cig ma ma yin pa la yang yid ches pa ma yin te slu ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyod kyis bsam pas skad cig ma ma yin pa la yang yid ches pa ma yin te slu ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: You may think that there is no confidence in what is not momentary, but that is not so, because of the perception of deception.

original: yid ches pa 'jig par byed pa'i ma rungs pa'i bdag nyid can rnams mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid ches pa 'jig par byed pa'i ma rungs pa'i bdag nyid can rnams mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the perception of the wicked who destroy confidence.

original: gzhan gyi khyad par la ni 'ga' zhig gi yid ches bar 'gyur ba kho na yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyi khyad par la ni 'ga' zhig gi yid ches bar 'gyur ba kho na yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: But there is confidence in the difference of another.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is: just as.

original: yid ches pa'i yul pha las gzhan pha dang mtshungs pa'i bu la de bzhin kho nar yid ches bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: yid ches pa'i yul pha las gzhan pha dang mtshungs pa'i bu la de bzhin kho nar yid ches bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Just as there is confidence in the son who is like the father, who is the object of confidence, so there is confidence in the other.

original: der yid ches bar 'gyur mod /
analyzed: der yid ches bar 'gyur mod /
translated: There is confidence in that.

original: skabs su bab pa la ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: skabs su bab pa la ci ltar zhe na /
translated: But what about the present case?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is: just as.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni yid ches ba'i yul snga ma'i nye bar len pa de rgyun gang la yod pa ste de la yid ches pa zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni yid ches ba'i yul snga ma'i nye bar len pa de rgyun gang la yod pa ste de la yid ches pa zhes 'brel to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin that‚Äù refers to the continuum of the prior appropriator, which is the object of trust.

original: gal te skad cig ma nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te skad cig ma nyid yin na /
translated: If it were momentary,

original: slar len par 'dod par mi 'gyur na yid ches pa yang yin te /
analyzed: slar len par 'dod par mi 'gyur na yid ches pa yang yin te /
translated: one would not desire to take it up again, and yet one does trust it.

original: des na skad cig ma yin pa de nyid do zhes dogs ba ba bsu ba ni //üîΩci ste zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na skad cig ma yin pa de nyid do zhes dogs ba ba bsu ba ni // ci ste zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is suspected that it is not momentary.üîΩThe response to this suspicion is ‚ÄúIf it were a unity . . . ‚Äù

original: lan ni gcig nyid yin na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni gcig nyid yin na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is ‚ÄúIf it were a unity . . . ‚Äù

original: ci ltar mi 'thad snyam na /
analyzed: ci ltar mi 'thad snyam na /
translated: How is this not tenable?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is ‚ÄúIn that case . . . ‚Äù

original: byin pa phyir len pa ni rigs so //
analyzed: byin pa phyir len pa ni rigs so //
translated: It would be reasonable to take back the gift.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: 'jigs pa'am ngo tsha bas so //
analyzed: 'jigs pa'am ngo tsha bas so //
translated: Out of fear or shame.

original: 'jigs pa dang ngo tsha bas rnam par 'gyur ba med pa'i bdag la 'jigs dang ngo tsha ba gang gis byas te /
analyzed: 'jigs pa dang ngo tsha bas rnam par 'gyur ba med pa'i bdag la 'jigs dang ngo tsha ba gang gis byas te /
translated: What fear or shame would cause a self that is changeless to take back a gift?

original: gang gis kyang ma byas so //üîΩdogs pa bsub ni /
analyzed: gang gis kyang ma byas so // dogs pa bsub ni /
translated: It would not be caused by anything.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to this suspicion is ‚ÄúIf it were . . . ‚Äù

original: nye bas zhes bya ba ni nor gyi bdag po mthong bas na'o //
analyzed: nye bas zhes bya ba ni nor gyi bdag po mthong bas na'o //
translated: The word near means that the owner of the wealth is seen.

original: bcol ba'i ka cha dang 'brel ba'i bdag nyid nor gyi bdag po des zin pa ste nye bar snyogs pa'o //
analyzed: bcol ba'i ka cha dang 'brel ba'i bdag nyid nor gyi bdag po des zin pa ste nye bar snyogs pa'o //
translated: The owner of the wealth is related to the object that is entrusted, and is seized by him, that is, is near.

original: des na bcol ba'i phyir ster bar rigs so zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: des na bcol ba'i phyir ster bar rigs so zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable that he should return the object that is entrusted.

original: lan ni de ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: lan ni de ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The answer is: That is not so.

original: skad cig ma yin par smra ba de ni bdag gi yul la nor gyi bdag po des zin pa ma @175a * //
analyzed: skad cig ma yin par smra ba de ni bdag gi yul la nor gyi bdag po des zin pa ma @175a * //
translated: For the one who advocates momentariness, the owner of the wealth does not seize the object in his domain.

original: yin yang / des zin pa nyid du rtogs pa ni 'khrul pa kho nar 'gyur gyi don dam pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yin yang / des zin pa nyid du rtogs pa ni 'khrul pa kho nar 'gyur gyi don dam pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But the cognition that it is seized by him is just an error, not an ultimate reality.

original: des na ji ltar des byas ba'i gtams ba phyir ster ba don dam ba bam yin bar 'gyur /
analyzed: des na ji ltar des byas ba'i gtams ba phyir ster ba don dam ba bam yin bar 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, how could it be that the return of the object that is entrusted is not ultimate?

original: 'on te gtams pa phyir ster ba ni don dam pa bam yin pa kho na yin na /
analyzed: 'on te gtams pa phyir ster ba ni don dam pa bam yin pa kho na yin na /
translated: But if the return of the object that is entrusted is not ultimate,

original: de ltan 'o na skad cig ma'i rgyun la yang gcig tu sgro btags pa las ci ste mi 'gyur zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de ltan 'o na skad cig ma'i rgyun la yang gcig tu sgro btags pa las ci ste mi 'gyur zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: then why is it not so in the case of the continuum of moments, since it is imputed as one?

original: 'khrul pa zhes bya ba'o //üîΩde nyid ces bya ba ni des ma zin kyang des zin pa'i rang bzhin nam /
analyzed: 'khrul pa zhes bya ba'o // de nyid ces bya ba ni des ma zin kyang des zin pa'i rang bzhin nam /
translated: is called ‚Äúerror.‚Äù

original: gcig nyid du 'dzin ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gcig nyid du 'dzin ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: ‚Äú That itself‚Äù means that even though it is not grasped by that, it is the nature of what is grasped by that, or it is the nature of grasping as one.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma ma yin par smra ba'i 'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma ma yin par smra ba'i 'o //
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to the one who maintains that there are no momentary events.

original: de lta'i tha snyad ces bya ba ni gtams ba sngar ster pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu'o //
analyzed: de lta'i tha snyad ces bya ba ni gtams ba sngar ster pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu'o //
translated: ‚Äú Such a convention‚Äù is the cause of the convention of the prior giving of the gift.

original: ci ltar na 'khrul pa kho na tha snyad kyi rgyu yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar na 'khrul pa kho na tha snyad kyi rgyu yin zhe na /
translated: How can error itself be the cause of a convention?

original: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba'o //üîΩrtag pa nyid la yang rgyu dang 'bras bu las zhes bya ba ni /üîΩnye bar len pa dang / nye bar len pa las byung bar rnam par gnas pa gcig nyid du lhag par zhen pa'i rgyu mtshan las /
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba'o // rtag pa nyid la yang rgyu dang 'bras bu las zhes bya ba ni / nye bar len pa dang / nye bar len pa las byung bar rnam par gnas pa gcig nyid du lhag par zhen pa'i rgyu mtshan las /
translated: ‚Äú By another‚Äù means by a different one.üîΩ‚Äú Even in permanence, from cause and effect‚Äù means that the cause of the adherence to the identity of the appropriator and the appropriated, and the cause of the adherence to the superimposition of identity, etc.,

original: gcig nyid la sogs par lhag par sgro 'dogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mngon par zhen pa'i rgyu gzhan rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gcig nyid la sogs par lhag par sgro 'dogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mngon par zhen pa'i rgyu gzhan rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi yod pa ma yin no //
translated: which has the characteristic of the superimposition of permanence, etc., do not exist.

original: 'khrul pas 'jig pa dang ngo tsha bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'khrul pas 'jig pa dang ngo tsha bar 'gyur la /
translated: and because of that error, they are destroyed and ashamed.

original: de dag gis kyang gtams pa phyir gtod pa'i 'dod bskyed de /
analyzed: de dag gis kyang gtams pa phyir gtod pa'i 'dod bskyed de /
translated: And because of that, they generate the desire to give up the self.

original: des na brgyud nas 'khrul bde kho na'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: des na brgyud nas 'khrul bde kho na'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Therefore, the self is the indirect cause of error and of pleasure and pain.

original: gzhan gyi rtag la'ang zhes bya ba rnam par 'grel pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rtag la'ang zhes bya ba rnam par 'grel pa ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúalso in regard to the self of others‚Äù is explained in the followingüîΩverse.

original: bdag rtag bar zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bdag rtag bar zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The verse states, ‚ÄúThe self is permanent.‚Äù

original: de dag gi 'jig rten pha rol dang ldan pa skyes bu'i rang bzhin rtag par ro //
analyzed: de dag gi 'jig rten pha rol dang ldan pa skyes bu'i rang bzhin rtag par ro //
translated: The self of others is permanent in the sense that it is eternal, and it is the nature of a person.

original: gcig tu mngon par zhen ba'i rgyu mtshan nye bar len pa dang nye bar len pa las byung ba dang rgyu dang 'bras bus byas ba'i mngon bar zhen bde las mi 'grel lo //
analyzed: gcig tu mngon par zhen ba'i rgyu mtshan nye bar len pa dang nye bar len pa las byung ba dang rgyu dang 'bras bus byas ba'i mngon bar zhen bde las mi 'grel lo //
translated: One does not give up the self because of the belief in the self that is based on the aggregates, which are the cause of the belief in the self, and because of the belief in the self that is based on the results of the aggregates, which are the effect of the belief in the self.

original: ci ltar de las mi 'grel snyam na /
analyzed: ci ltar de las mi 'grel snyam na /
translated: How does one not give up the self?

original: 'jigs dang ngo tshas 'gyur med kyi zhes bya ba rnam bar 'grel bas lan 'debs pa ni /
analyzed: 'jigs dang ngo tshas 'gyur med kyi zhes bya ba rnam bar 'grel bas lan 'debs pa ni /
translated: The verse responds: ‚ÄúBecause of fear and shame, one does not give up the self.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin this way‚Äù refers to the above explanation.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni 'pho ba ma yin pas so //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni 'pho ba ma yin pas so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äútherefore‚Äù refers to the fact that the self does not transmigrate.

original: de la ni bdag la'o //
analyzed: de la ni bdag la'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin regard to that‚Äù refers to the self.

original: 'jigs pa la sogs pas zhes bya ba ni 'jigs pa dang do tsha ba tha dad par gyur bas so //
analyzed: 'jigs pa la sogs pas zhes bya ba ni 'jigs pa dang do tsha ba tha dad par gyur bas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy fear, etc.‚Äù means by fear and shame, which are different.

original: ci ltar rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid kyis bsdigs zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ci ltar rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid kyis bsdigs zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: How is it that there is a change in aspect? The meaning is that there is a threat.

original: 'on te de dang nye bas zhes bya ba rnam par 'grel pa ni /
analyzed: 'on te de dang nye bas zhes bya ba rnam par 'grel pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúOr, by being near it‚Äù is the explanation.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOr‚Äù means ‚Äúif.‚Äù

original: de ni bdag go de dang ldan pas ni 'jigs pa la sogs pa dang ldan pas so //üîΩde ni bdag nyid des zin pa min yang zhes bya /
analyzed: de ni bdag go de dang ldan pas ni 'jigs pa la sogs pa dang ldan pas so // de ni bdag nyid des zin pa min yang zhes bya /
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù is the self. ‚ÄúBy being near it‚Äù means by being near the self.üîΩ‚ÄúEven though it is not grasped by that‚Äù is the explanation.

original: @175b ba rnam par 'grel pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: @175b ba rnam par 'grel pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not‚Äù means ‚Äúit is not so.‚Äù

original: bdag de la gnod pa ci yang med do zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: bdag de la gnod pa ci yang med do zhes 'brel to //
translated: ‚ÄúThere is no harm at all to that self‚Äù is the connection.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is it?

original: rang gi ngo bo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBy its own nature.‚Äù

original: 'on ci ltar bdag tu smra ba rnams kyi ltar na 'jigs pa dang 'dzem pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'on ci ltar bdag tu smra ba rnams kyi ltar na 'jigs pa dang 'dzem pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But how, according to the proponents of the self, is there the convention of fear, shame, etc.?

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBy the relation of cause and effect.‚Äù

original: de lta bu'i zhes bya ba ni 'jigs pa dang 'dzem pa nyid du tha snyad byed pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i zhes bya ba ni 'jigs pa dang 'dzem pa nyid du tha snyad byed pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Such is the cause of the conventional expression fear and shame.

original: 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad tsam gyis gnod pa gang yin ba de ni gnod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad tsam gyis gnod pa gang yin ba de ni gnod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The harm that is due to the mere conventional expression of fear, etc. is not harm.

original: 'on kyang bdag gi rang bzhin rnam ba gzhan du gyur pa nyid gnod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang bdag gi rang bzhin rnam ba gzhan du gyur pa nyid gnod pa yin no //
translated: But rather, the transformation of the nature of the self is harm.

original: gnod byed tha dad pas gnod par 'gyur ba nyid du dogs pa bsu pa ni /
analyzed: gnod byed tha dad pas gnod par 'gyur ba nyid du dogs pa bsu pa ni /
translated: The objection that harm is due to the difference of the one who is harmed is anticipated and answered in the statement:

original: tha dad kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tha dad kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Even though there is a difference.

original: bu'i gnod pas ni gnod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bu'i gnod pas ni gnod pa ma yin no //
translated: The harm of the son is not harm.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i zhes bya ba'o /
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba'o /
translated: Because of that.

original: des zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bor gyur pas so //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bor gyur pas so //
translated: That refers to the nature of the self.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gzhan la gnod pas kyang gdon na'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gzhan la gnod pas kyang gdon na'o //
translated: Otherwise refers to the case where harm is due to the harm of another.

original: 'on te bu dang ni gang 'brel bas na de'i gnod pas gnod par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'on te bu dang ni gang 'brel bas na de'i gnod pas gnod par 'gyur gyi /
translated: But if the harm of the son is harm because of the relation to him,

original: dgra'i gnod pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dgra'i gnod pas ni ma yin te /
translated: the harm of the enemy is not harm,

original: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because there is no relation.

original: de dang yang zhes bya ba ste dgra dang ngo //
analyzed: de dang yang zhes bya ba ste dgra dang ngo //
translated: and also to the son, i.e., the enemy.

original: des na 'brel ba yod kyang ci ltar dgra la gnod pas mi gnod pa de bzhin du bu la gnod pas kyang gnod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na 'brel ba yod kyang ci ltar dgra la gnod pas mi gnod pa de bzhin du bu la gnod pas kyang gnod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, even though there is a connection, just as the father is not harmed by the harm to the enemy, so also he is not harmed by the harm to the son.

original: 'gyur ba yang yin te /
analyzed: 'gyur ba yang yin te /
translated: But there is harm,

original: des na bu sdug bsngal bar mthong bas pha'i rgyud la gnod pa gzhan kho na zhig skye ba yin no //
analyzed: des na bu sdug bsngal bar mthong bas pha'i rgyud la gnod pa gzhan kho na zhig skye ba yin no //
translated: because when the father sees the son suffering, another kind of harm arises in the continuum of the father.

original: gal te pha la gnod pa gzhan yod par ma gyur na /
analyzed: gal te pha la gnod pa gzhan yod par ma gyur na /
translated: If there were no other harm to the father,

original: de'i tshe ni bu'i gnod pas gnod par mi 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de'i tshe ni bu'i gnod pas gnod par mi 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: then he would not be harmed by the harm to the son.üîΩThis is what is said in the phrase ‚Äúif there were no other harm to the father.

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf‚Äù means ‚Äúif it were to exist.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir de ltar gzhan gyi gnod pas gnod ba ma yin pa des na'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar gzhan gyi gnod pas gnod ba ma yin pa des na'o //
translated: Because there is no harm from the harm to another,

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni res 'ga' gnod ba'i rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni res 'ga' gnod ba'i rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äútherefore‚Äù means ‚Äúsometimes, because of the nature of harm.üîΩ‚Äù

original: rgyun las zhes bya ba ni skad cig brag yud ma las so //
analyzed: rgyun las zhes bya ba ni skad cig brag yud ma las so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom the continuum‚Äù means from the moment, the instant.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni rgyun tsam yin pas na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni rgyun tsam yin pas na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means ‚Äúbecause of the mere continuum.üîΩ‚Äù

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat itself‚Äù is explained as follows.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore,

original: de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya ba ni tha snyad kyis na'o //
analyzed: de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya ba ni tha snyad kyis na'o //
translated: means that this is just that.

original: 'di ni dgra'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dgra'o //
translated: This is the enemy.

original: de'i ste skye ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba'i rkyen gyi byed gzhis  tha dad pa'i rtags te /
analyzed: de'i ste skye ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba'i rkyen gyi byed gzhis  tha dad pa'i rtags te /
translated: The sign of difference in the causal activity of that, i.e., of the characteristic of origination,

original: de dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is because of its possession.

original: rkyen gyi bye brag gis tha dad ba nyid las /
analyzed: rkyen gyi bye brag gis tha dad ba nyid las /
translated: From the difference in causal activity,

original: 'bras bu nyid du grub pas na rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i yul yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid du grub pas na rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i yul yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the establishment of the effect is the domain of inference, i.e., of the valid cognition of inference. This is the meaning.

original: de nyid brjod pa ni rkyen gyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid brjod pa ni rkyen gyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The expression of that is the causal activity, etc.

original: gsal byed kyi dbye bas kyang tha dad bar dogs pa bsu ba @176a * //
analyzed: gsal byed kyi dbye bas kyang tha dad bar dogs pa bsu ba @176a * //
translated: The doubt that the difference is due to the difference of the manifestor is anticipated:

original: ni ; ci ste zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ni ; ci ste zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is said,

original: de las gzhan pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyi 'bras bu gsal bar byed pa gang la yod pa de'i dngos po nyid de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyi 'bras bu gsal bar byed pa gang la yod pa de'i dngos po nyid de'i phyir ro //
translated: then the nature of that which is the manifestor of the effect that is different from that, i.e., from the causal activity, exists in that, i.e., in the effect.

original: de'i rang bzhin las ni bum pa'i rang bzhin las so //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin las ni bum pa'i rang bzhin las so //
translated: From that nature, i.e., from the nature of the pot,

original: rang gi rang bzhin nyams pa'i phyogs la sun 'byin pa brjod pa ni /
analyzed: rang gi rang bzhin nyams pa'i phyogs la sun 'byin pa brjod pa ni /
translated: The refutation of the position that the nature of the object is impaired is

original: de la med pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la med pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: as follows: ‚ÄúIt is not in that.‚Äù

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni med pa yang gsal bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni med pa yang gsal bar bya ba yin no //
translated: ‚Äú Elsewhere‚Äù means that the non-existent is also manifested.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gsal byed de'i rang bzhin gzhan du byed pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gsal byed de'i rang bzhin gzhan du byed pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: ‚Äú But‚Äù means that the nature of the manifestation is not made otherwise,

original: 'on kyang 'khrul pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'khrul pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: but rather, it is an error. This is the meaning.

original: 'on ci ltar gsal byed yin snyam na /
analyzed: 'on ci ltar gsal byed yin snyam na /
translated: But how is it a manifestation?

original: 'ga' zhig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ces bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú Some‚Äù means some people.

original: de lta yin na zhes bya ba ni 'khrul pa skyed par byed pa yang gsal bar byed pa yin na'o //
analyzed: de lta yin na zhes bya ba ni 'khrul pa skyed par byed pa yang gsal bar byed pa yin na'o //
translated: ‚Äú If that were so‚Äù means if the production of error were a manifestation.

original: de dag la yang zhes bya ba ni rab rib la sogs pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: de dag la yang zhes bya ba ni rab rib la sogs pa la yang ngo //
translated: ‚Äú In that case‚Äù means in the case of cataracts, etc.

original: 'on te 'khrul yang zhes bya ba ni chung du dad chen po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du 'khrul kyang ngo //
analyzed: 'on te 'khrul yang zhes bya ba ni chung du dad chen po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du 'khrul kyang ngo //
translated: ‚Äú But even in error‚Äù means even in the error of the nature of small and large, etc.

original: de'i ni sgra'i'o //
analyzed: de'i ni sgra'i'o //
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to the sound.

original: gzhan ni che chung la sogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni che chung la sogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: ‚Äú The other‚Äù refers to the nature of small and large, etc.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa des na rtsol ba la sogs pa ni gdangs de'i gsal byed yin ba 'dod na'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa des na rtsol ba la sogs pa ni gdangs de'i gsal byed yin ba 'dod na'o //
translated: Therefore, it is maintained that the manifestation of that radiance is the manifestation of effort, etc.

original: 'chad pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //üîΩde ni zhes bya ba ni sgra tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: 'chad pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o // de ni zhes bya ba ni sgra tha dad pa'o //
translated: The explanation is: ‚ÄúIf . . . ‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúThat‚Äù is a different sound.

original: de kho na nyid gzhan zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de kho na nyid gzhan zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúReality‚Äù is a different sound.

original: yi ge ga la sogs pa la tha dad pa go ba'i sgra nyid do //
analyzed: yi ge ga la sogs pa la tha dad pa go ba'i sgra nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúOther‚Äù is a different sound for the letters ‚Äúga‚Äù and so on.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid tha dad par mi snang na chen po dang chung du la sogs pa'i dbye bas 'khrul pa nyid du rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid tha dad par mi snang na chen po dang chung du la sogs pa'i dbye bas 'khrul pa nyid du rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù means that if reality does not appear as different, then the distinction of large and small, etc., would not be understood as error.

original: rnam pa thams cad du zla ba gcig tha dad par mi snang na ni /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du zla ba gcig tha dad par mi snang na ni /
translated: If the one moon does not appear as different in every way,

original: zla ba gnyis su snang ba 'khrul pa nyid du rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zla ba gnyis su snang ba 'khrul pa nyid du rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then the appearance of two moons would not be understood as error.

original: 'on te yang tha dad par mi snang yang de tha dad pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te yang tha dad par mi snang yang de tha dad pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if it does not appear as different, and yet it is different,

original: tha dad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: tha dad ces bya ba'o //
translated: then it is different.
