translated: If sound is both one and many,

original: ngo shes pa de yang tshad ma ma yin pa nyid du sngar byas pas na ci ltar gcig nyid du sgrub par byed /
analyzed: ngo shes pa de yang tshad ma ma yin pa nyid du sngar byas pas na ci ltar gcig nyid du sgrub par byed /
translated: since it has been shown that recognition is not a valid cognition, how does it establish one?

original: gal te gnyi ga mi bden na /
analyzed: gal te gnyi ga mi bden na /
translated: If both are not real,

original: 'o na ci bden zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci bden zhe na /
translated: then what is real?

original: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhen‚Äù is the word.

original: ci ltar na tha dad pa nyid bden zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar na tha dad pa nyid bden zhe na /
translated: How could difference itself be real?

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ste tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ste tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore means because of difference.

original: tha mi dad la ste /
analyzed: tha mi dad la ste /
translated: In the case of nondifference,

original: snga ma dang phyi ma'i dus dag tu gcig pa la ni /
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma'i dus dag tu gcig pa la ni /
translated: in the case of sameness at prior and subsequent times,

original: tha dad kyi rang bzhin gzung bar bya ba phyi rol bden pa tshad ma dang ldan pa ni gang la'ang med do //
analyzed: tha dad kyi rang bzhin gzung bar bya ba phyi rol bden pa tshad ma dang ldan pa ni gang la'ang med do //
translated: there is no object of apprehension that is a nature of difference, which is a real external object that possesses valid knowledge.

original: de'i phyir tha dad pa kho na bden pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir tha dad pa kho na bden pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, difference alone is real.

original: 'o na tha mi dad pa ci ltar 'grub snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na tha mi dad pa ci ltar 'grub snyam na /
translated: But how is nondifference established?

original: tha dad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: tha dad ces bya ba'o //
translated: It is called difference.

original: 'o na tha mi dad pa @183b yang bden pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na tha mi dad pa @183b yang bden pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if nondifference is real,

original: rnam rtog de ni tshad ma min te /
analyzed: rnam rtog de ni tshad ma min te /
translated: that conception is not valid knowledge.

original: des na ci ltar des grub pa'i tha mi dad pa mi bden pa nyid du gyur /
analyzed: des na ci ltar des grub pa'i tha mi dad pa mi bden pa nyid du gyur /
translated: Therefore, how could nondifference, which is established by that, be unreal?

original: phyed phyi ma 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: phyed phyi ma 'chad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the latter half of the verse is as follows.

original: tha dad pa nyid bden pa yin na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa nyid bden pa yin na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If difference itself were real,

original: gal te gang gis 'di de ltar khas len par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: gal te gang gis 'di de ltar khas len par 'gyur ba /
translated: then by what would this be accepted in that way?

original: tha dad pa mi bden na ci nyes snyam na /
analyzed: tha dad pa mi bden na ci nyes snyam na /
translated: If difference were unreal, what would be wrong with that?

original: tha dad pa mi bden na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: tha dad pa mi bden na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: If difference is not real, then what is the basis of nondifference?

original: gal te tha dad pa mi bden par khas len na de'i tshe tha mi dad pa de chos can gang zhig gis yin te /
analyzed: gal te tha dad pa mi bden par khas len na de'i tshe tha mi dad pa de chos can gang zhig gis yin te /
translated: If you accept that difference is not real, then at that time, what is the basis of nondifference?

original: gang gi yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not the basis of anything.

original: 'on te tha mi dad pa kho na bden pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te tha mi dad pa kho na bden pa yin te /
translated: But if nondifference alone is real,

original: de tsam gyis tha snyad byed pa'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de tsam gyis tha snyad byed pa'i phyir zhe na /
translated: then because of that alone, there is designation.

original: tha mi dad pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba'o //üîΩgang gi phyir tha dad pa mi bden pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: tha mi dad pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba'o // gang gi phyir tha dad pa mi bden pa nyid yin na /
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúBy nondifference alone.‚ÄùüîΩBecause difference is not real,

original: tha mi dad pa gang gis yang chos su mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: tha mi dad pa gang gis yang chos su mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: then by what nondifference would there be a phenomenon?

original: tha mi dad pa tsam gyis kyang tha snyad du mi 'gyur ba de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa tsam gyis kyang tha snyad du mi 'gyur ba de'i phyir ro //
translated: And because of nondifference alone, there would be no designation.

original: tha dad pa mi bden yang de'i tha mi dad pa ci ste bden par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: tha dad pa mi bden yang de'i tha mi dad pa ci ste bden par mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But if difference is not real, then why would its nondifference not be real?

original: chos can zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: chos can zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúThe basis of designation.‚Äù

original: de ltar ni bden par ro //
analyzed: de ltar ni bden par ro //
translated: It is like this: it is real.

original: dpe brjod pa ni ri bong gi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dpe brjod pa ni ri bong gi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: An example is given: ‚ÄúLike the horn of a rabbit.‚Äù

original: tha dad pa ni tha mi dad pa la mi ltos par rang nyid kho nas yin no zhes lan brjod pa ni /
analyzed: tha dad pa ni tha mi dad pa la mi ltos par rang nyid kho nas yin no zhes lan brjod pa ni /
translated: The response is: ‚ÄúThe different is not dependent on the non-different, but is itself alone.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú In this way‚Äù means:

original: rgyu gang gi phyir chos can gyi rang bzhin du gyur pa tha mi dad pa gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa med pa'i rgyu de nyid kyi phyir de tha dad pa yin no zhes brjod de /
analyzed: rgyu gang gi phyir chos can gyi rang bzhin du gyur pa tha mi dad pa gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa med pa'i rgyu de nyid kyi phyir de tha dad pa yin no zhes brjod de /
translated: Because of the reason, the nature of the subject is not different, and there is no connection with the dependent characteristic, for that very reason it is said to be different.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba tha mi dad pa dang / tha dad pa gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid kyi 'brel ba yod na /
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba tha mi dad pa dang / tha dad pa gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid kyi 'brel ba yod na /
translated: ‚Äú Otherwise‚Äù means: if there were a connection between the non-different and the different dependent characteristics,

original: chos can tha dad pa nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos can tha dad pa nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: the difference of the subject would be lost.

original: tha dad par bya ba'i dngos po nyid tha dad pa yin la /
analyzed: tha dad par bya ba'i dngos po nyid tha dad pa yin la /
translated: The very thing that is to be made different is the difference,

original: de yang chos can kho na yin te rten med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang chos can kho na yin te rten med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and that is the subject itself, because it has no basis.

original: tha dad pa ni tha dad par bya bar dmigs pa dag gi /'das pa'i bdag nyid kyi chos tha dad pa la brten pa yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa ni tha dad par bya bar dmigs pa dag gi /'das pa'i bdag nyid kyi chos tha dad pa la brten pa yin no //
translated: The difference is based on the difference of the past nature of those that are observed as different.

original: de nyid kyi phyir brjod pa tha mi dad pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir brjod pa tha mi dad pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúbecause of the non-difference of the expression.‚Äù

original: spyi'i chos bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dper na ba lang nyid la sogs pa'i spyi tha dad pa bsal na mi 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: spyi'i chos bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dper na ba lang nyid la sogs pa'i spyi tha dad pa bsal na mi 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: ‚ÄúLike a universal property‚Äù means, for example, that the universal property of cowness, etc., is not destroyed when the difference is removed.

original: de bzhin du tha mi dad pa yang tha dad pa gsal na 'tsham pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du tha mi dad pa yang tha dad pa gsal na 'tsham pa ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, non-difference is not tenable when the difference is removed.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rtag pa dang / dmigs pa'i 'bras bu res 'ga' ba ni 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rtag pa dang / dmigs pa'i 'bras bu res 'ga' ba ni 'gal ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the effect of the object of apprehension is sometimes contradictory to permanence.

original: de kho na bzhin du zhes bya ba ni chad pa med pa'i rang bzhin nyid du'o //
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du zhes bya ba ni chad pa med pa'i rang bzhin nyid du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúJust as‚Äù means in the nature of non-cessation.

original: rnam par chad pa zhes bya ba da ltar ba tsam gyi gnas skabs 'dzin pa gang yin pa der mi 'gyur ro //üîΩci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par chad pa zhes bya ba da ltar ba tsam gyi gnas skabs 'dzin pa gang yin pa der mi 'gyur ro // ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúThe division‚Äù is the apprehension of the present state, which would not occur.üîΩWhy is that?
‚ÄúBecause of that,‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba ste khyab pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste khyab pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: which is the nature of pervasion.

original: gzhan la zhes bya ba shes pa gzhan la ltos nas 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la zhes bya ba shes pa gzhan la ltos nas 'dzin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn another‚Äù means the apprehension in dependence on another cognition.

original: ci'i phyir de ltar mi 'dzin snyam na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ltar mi 'dzin snyam na /
translated: Why is it not apprehended in that way?

original: de yang zhes bya ba ste bzung bzhin pa da ltar ba yang ngo //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ste bzung bzhin pa da ltar ba yang ngo //
translated: and also the present, which is being grasped.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rtag pa yin na 'bras bu res 'ga' bar 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rtag pa yin na 'bras bu res 'ga' bar 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, because it is permanent, it is contradictory that the effect is sometimes obtained.

original: khyab pa bsgrubs nas phyogs kyi chos nyid brjod pa ni /
analyzed: khyab pa bsgrubs nas phyogs kyi chos nyid brjod pa ni /
translated: Having established the pervasion, he states the property of the position:

original: des na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore,

original: da ltar gyi gnas skabs 'dzin par byed pa shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'bras bu las sgra mi rtag pa nyid du rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: da ltar gyi gnas skabs 'dzin par byed pa shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'bras bu las sgra mi rtag pa nyid du rtogs pa yin no //
translated: the present state is grasped by the characteristic of consciousness, and the sound is understood to be impermanent due to the effect.

original: gal te brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di nyid kyis rang bzhin dang 'bras bu gnyi ga bstan pa 'grub pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di nyid kyis rang bzhin dang 'bras bu gnyi ga bstan pa 'grub pa ma yin nam /
translated: If it is said that this very statement, ‚Äúbecause it occurs immediately upon exertion,‚Äù establishes both the nature and the effect,

original: des na byas pa'i phyir zhes bstan pas ci bya zhe na /
analyzed: des na byas pa'i phyir zhes bstan pas ci bya zhe na /
translated: then what is the point of stating ‚Äúbecause it is produced‚Äù?

original: dogs pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dogs pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The doubt is stated with ‚Äúif.‚Äù

original: 'di nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di nyid kyis rang bzhin nyid grub kyang byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i rang bzhin 'di tha dad par byas pa ni'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di nyid kyis rang bzhin nyid grub kyang byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i rang bzhin 'di tha dad par byas pa ni'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBy this very fact‚Äù means that it is established by this very fact that it arises immediately upon the exertion of effort.

original: gal te tshul gsum rtags las don mthong ba'o zhes /
analyzed: gal te tshul gsum rtags las don mthong ba'o zhes /
translated: If the three modes are the evidence from which one sees the proposition,

original: rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid bshad zin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid bshad zin pa ma yin nam /
translated: then isn‚Äôt the definition of inference for oneself explained?üîΩIf that is explained, then why is this said: ‚ÄúIn that regard, the evidence is present in similar instances‚Äù?

original: de skad bshad nas yang 'di skad ces de la rigs mthun la yod dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang gsungs pa de ni zlos pa yin no zhes dogs pa ni /
analyzed: de skad bshad nas yang 'di skad ces de la rigs mthun la yod dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang gsungs pa de ni zlos pa yin no zhes dogs pa ni /
translated: This is the suspicion of redundancy.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sog pa'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sog pa'o //
translated: The response begins with ‚ÄúIf you think . . .‚Äù

original: rtogs don du zhes bya ba'i lan gyi don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: rtogs don du zhes bya ba'i lan gyi don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of the response is as follows.

original: gal te yang don 'di ni rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid kho nas bsdus pa de lta na yang don de nyid rgyas par bstan pa'i don du de la rigs mthun la yod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te yang don 'di ni rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid kho nas bsdus pa de lta na yang don de nyid rgyas par bstan pa'i don du de la rigs mthun la yod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod pa yin no //
translated: Even if this meaning is included only by the definition of inference for oneself, still, in order to teach that very meaning extensively, he says, ‚ÄúIt exists in what is similar,‚Äù and so on.

original: rigs mthun la yod ces bya ba 'dis ni gtan tshigs mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad khyab par bzung ngo //
analyzed: rigs mthun la yod ces bya ba 'dis ni gtan tshigs mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad khyab par bzung ngo //
translated: By saying ‚ÄúIt exists in what is similar,‚Äù he includes all similar instances that are pervaded by the reason.

original: rnam gnyis zhes bya ba 'dis ni mthun pa'i phyogs gcig la yod pa bzung ngo //
analyzed: rnam gnyis zhes bya ba 'dis ni mthun pa'i phyogs gcig la yod pa bzung ngo //
translated: By saying ‚Äúin two ways,‚Äù he includes the existence in one similar instance.

original: de la rigs mthun zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod pa med na ni /
analyzed: de la rigs mthun zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod pa med na ni /
translated: If he did not say ‚ÄúIt exists in what is similar,‚Äù and so on,

original: tshul gsum rtags las don mthong yin //
analyzed: tshul gsum rtags las don mthong yin //
translated: then the words ‚ÄúThe object is seen from the reason having three modes‚ÄùüîΩwould only include the apprehension of the two kinds of immediate perception.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis brtsal ma thag tu 'byung pa rnam pa gnyis kyis 'jug pa kho na 'dzin par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis brtsal ma thag tu 'byung pa rnam pa gnyis kyis 'jug pa kho na 'dzin par 'gyur gyi /
translated: But if he said ‚ÄúIt exists in what is similar,‚Äù and so on, then the words ‚ÄúThe object is seen from the reason having three modes‚Äù would also include the apprehension of the two kinds of inference.

original: byas pa nyid na mi yin no //
analyzed: byas pa nyid na mi yin no //
translated: For example, ‚ÄúIt is impermanent because it is produced.‚Äù

original: rjes su dpag par zhes bya ba ni tshul gsum rtags las don mthong ba'i zhes bya ba rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag par ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag par zhes bya ba ni tshul gsum rtags las don mthong ba'i zhes bya ba rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag par ro //
translated: The phrase inferred later means that the object is seen from the evidence by means of the trimodal condition.

original: gtan @184b tshigs brjod byas zhes bya ba ni de la rigs mthun zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod par byas pa'o //
analyzed: gtan @184b tshigs brjod byas zhes bya ba ni de la rigs mthun zhes bya ba la sogs pa brjod par byas pa'o //
translated: The phrase the statement of the reason refers to the statement of the trimodal condition, beginning with the words the presence of the reason in the subject.

original: rab tu dbye ba tsam zhes rigs mthun pa thams cad la yod pa dang / de la rnam pa gnyis su 'jug pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //üîΩmtshan nyid la ni zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba tsam zhes rigs mthun pa thams cad la yod pa dang / de la rnam pa gnyis su 'jug pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // mtshan nyid la ni zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase merely a classification refers to the fact that the presence of the reason in similar instances and the absence of the reason in dissimilar instances are both present in all similar instances.

original: tshul gsum rtags las don mthong yin //üîΩzhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid la tha dad pa med pa ste /
analyzed: tshul gsum rtags las don mthong yin // zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid la tha dad pa med pa ste /
translated: The phrase in the definition refers to the definition of the trimodal condition, which is stated in the words, the seeing of the object from the evidence by means of the trimodal condition.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs la khyab pa dang // rnam pa gnyis ka la 'jug pa thams cad la yod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde lta ma yin te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs la khyab pa dang // rnam pa gnyis ka la 'jug pa thams cad la yod pa'i phyir ro // de lta ma yin te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: There is no difference between the definition and the classification, because the presence of the reason in similar instances and the absence of the reason in dissimilar instances are both present in all similar instances.

original: gal te de la rigs mthun la yod dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ma byas na /
analyzed: gal te de la rigs mthun la yod dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ma byas na /
translated: The phrase otherwise means that if the statement of the trimodal condition were not made, beginning with the words the presence of the reason in similar instances,

original: rigs mthun pa yod pa kho na zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni dper brjod pa med pa'i phyir mtshan nyid mi byed pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rigs mthun pa yod pa kho na zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni dper brjod pa med pa'i phyir mtshan nyid mi byed pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: That which is called ‚Äúhaving a similar type‚Äù is not a characteristic at all, because there is no example.

original: gal te mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa gtan tshigs kyis mtshan nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa gtan tshigs kyis mtshan nyid ma yin nam /
translated: If the opposite of the discordant side is not the characteristic of the reason,

original: de ni mthun pa'i phyogs la khyab pa dang ma khyab pa la yang mtshungs pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de ni mthun pa'i phyogs la khyab pa dang ma khyab pa la yang mtshungs pa kho na yin te /
translated: then it is the same in the case of pervasion and non-pervasion in the concordant side.

original: des na thams cad bsdus pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des na thams cad bsdus pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, if all are included,

original: dogs pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dogs pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the doubt is stated with ‚Äúif.‚Äù

original: de lta na zhes bya ba ni gsum bstan na'o //
analyzed: de lta na zhes bya ba ni gsum bstan na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case‚Äù means if the three are taught.

original: 'dir ni gtan tshigs kyi 'khor lor ro //üîΩgang gi phyir 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi mthun pa'i phyogs gcig la brten pa'i rang bzhin brjod par 'dod pa des na /
analyzed: 'dir ni gtan tshigs kyi 'khor lor ro // gang gi phyir 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi mthun pa'i phyogs gcig la brten pa'i rang bzhin brjod par 'dod pa des na /
translated: Here, in the wheel of reasons,üîΩbecause the reason of effect is based on one concordant side, the nature is stated.

original: rtsol pa las gsal ba dang skye ba la brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba'i phyir 'dra par dper brjod pa gcig brjod do //
analyzed: rtsol pa las gsal ba dang skye ba la brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba'i phyir 'dra par dper brjod pa gcig brjod do //
translated: Therefore, since manifestation and arising occur immediately after effort, one example is stated as similar.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin bstan pas mi bzhed na'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin bstan pas mi bzhed na'o //
translated: then, if one did not accept the teaching of intrinsic nature,üîΩthen,

original: des na zhes bya ba ni shin tu gsal ba'i 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs dper ma brjod pas na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni shin tu gsal ba'i 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs dper ma brjod pas na'o //
translated: because the example of the effect of the reason is not stated very clearly,

original: gal te gnyi ga rtsol ba'i 'bras bu ci ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gnyi ga rtsol ba'i 'bras bu ci ltar yin zhe na /
translated: if both are the effect of effort, how is it?

original: shes pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shes pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Consciousness also.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rtsod par ni don 'di yin te /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rtsod par ni don 'di yin te /
translated: If, etc., the dispute has this meaning:

original: rtsol bas na sgra'i rang bzhin kho na byed pa yin la /
analyzed: rtsol bas na sgra'i rang bzhin kho na byed pa yin la /
translated: Because of effort, the nature of sound is the only activity.

original: rtsol bas byas pa des ni shes pa yin no //
analyzed: rtsol bas byas pa des ni shes pa yin no //
translated: By that which is made by effort, there is consciousness.

original: des na shes pa yang rtsol ba las byung bar ci ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na shes pa yang rtsol ba las byung bar ci ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, how can consciousness also arise from effort?

original: de ni mi rigs te zhes bya ba'i lan de la yang don 'di yin te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te zhes bya ba'i lan de la yang don 'di yin te /
translated: That is not correct. The reply to that has this meaning:

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba sngar ma bzung na'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba sngar ma bzung na'o //
translated: If it were not so, i.e., if it were not previously apprehended,

original: do nyid brjod pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: do nyid brjod pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the expression ‚Äúthus‚Äù would not be used.

original: ci'i phyir ma bzung ba la mi 'jug snyam na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ma bzung ba la mi 'jug snyam na /
translated: Why does it not engage what is not apprehended?

original: gang gi phyir bzung ba nyid dran pas na'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bzung ba nyid dran pas na'o //
translated: Because it is only the apprehended that is remembered.

original: 'dzin pas ni bdag nyid 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin 'dzin par byed pa nyid du mi rtogs la /
analyzed: 'dzin pas ni bdag nyid 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin 'dzin par byed pa nyid du mi rtogs la /
translated: It is amazing that the apprehender does not understand itself to be the nature of the apprehension of what is to arise,üîΩbut that it is understood by the memory that follows after it.

original: de'i rjes su 'brang ba'i dran pas ni rtogs so zhes bya ba ni mtshar che'o zhes lan 'debs ba ni ngas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'brang ba'i dran pas ni rtogs so zhes bya ba ni mtshar che'o zhes lan 'debs ba ni ngas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is ‚ÄúI say‚Äù

original: gang la zhes bya ba ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba la'o //
analyzed: gang la zhes bya ba ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba la'o //
translated: ‚Äúin regard to what‚Äù means in regard to what is to arise.

original: 'dzin par byed pa zhes bya ba ni shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin par byed pa zhes bya ba ni shes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe apprehender‚Äù is consciousness.

original: de nyid kyi phyir shes pa po yod pa yin na 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin nam zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir shes pa po yod pa yin na 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin nam zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: That is why it will be explained that ‚Äúif the existent cognizer exists, the nature of the apprehender exists.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir de la mngon sum gyi byed pa med snyam na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de la mngon sum gyi byed pa med snyam na /
translated: Why does it not have the activity of direct perception in regard to that?üîΩ‚ÄúIn regard to what is to arise‚Äù

original: 'byung ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The arising is the arising of the effect.

original: ci ste bzung ba mi nus snyam na /
analyzed: ci ste bzung ba mi nus snyam na /
translated: If you think that it cannot be apprehended,

original: the tshom za ba'i phyir te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: the tshom za ba'i phyir te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: it is because of doubt.üîΩIf you think that it is not apprehended,üîΩthen it is not tenable that the object exists.

original: ci ste zhes bya ba nas 'dod na zhes bya ba'i bar ni rtsod pa'o //
analyzed: ci ste zhes bya ba nas 'dod na zhes bya ba'i bar ni rtsod pa'o //
translated: If you think that it is apprehended,üîΩthen it is not tenable that it is past.üîΩIf you think that it is both apprehended and not apprehended,

original: de'i tshe zhes khong nas phyung la /
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes khong nas phyung la /
translated: then it is not tenable that it is past.üîΩIf you think that it is neither apprehended nor not apprehended,üîΩthen it is not tenable that it is past.üîΩIf you think that it is apprehended,

original: ngas bzung ba nyid do zhes rnam pa de ltar mthong ba'i dus phyis byung ba'i dran pas yul du byed par 'gyur ro zhes rtogs pa'i rgyu'i phyir ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin de yang bzung ba kho na'o //
analyzed: ngas bzung ba nyid do zhes rnam pa de ltar mthong ba'i dus phyis byung ba'i dran pas yul du byed par 'gyur ro zhes rtogs pa'i rgyu'i phyir ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin de yang bzung ba kho na'o //
translated: then it is not tenable that it is past.

original: ci ltar yul du byed snyam na /
analyzed: ci ltar yul du byed snyam na /
translated: If you think that it is not apprehended,üîΩthen it is not tenable that it is past.üîΩIf you think that it is both apprehended and not apprehended,üîΩthen it is not tenable that it is past.üîΩIf you think that it is neither apprehended nor not apprehended,üîΩthen it is not tenable that it is past.

original: bzung ba nyid do zhes bya bar ro //
analyzed: bzung ba nyid do zhes bya bar ro //
translated: If you think that it is apprehended,üîΩthen it is not tenable that it is past.üîΩIf you think that it is not apprehended,üîΩthen it is not tenable that it is past.üîΩIf you think that it is both apprehended and not apprehended,üîΩthen it is not tenable that it is past.üîΩIf you think that it is neither apprehended nor not apprehended,üîΩthen it is not tenable that it is past.üîΩIf you think that it is apprehended,üîΩthen it is not tenable that it is past.üîΩIf you think that it is not apprehended,

original: lan ni mngon sum gyis 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin gzung ba ni mi rung ngo //üîΩci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: lan ni mngon sum gyis 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin gzung ba ni mi rung ngo // ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: then it is not tenable that it is past.

original: bzung ba la yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bzung ba la yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you think that it is both apprehended and not apprehended,üîΩthen it is not tenable that it is past.üîΩIf you think that it is neither apprehended nor not apprehended,üîΩthen it is not tenable that it is past.üîΩIf you think that it is apprehended,üîΩthen it is not tenable that it is past.üîΩIf you think that it is not apprehended,

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba la ni re zhig 'dzin pa mi srid pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba la ni re zhig 'dzin pa mi srid pa nyid do //
translated: then it is not tenable that it is past.üîΩIf you think that it is both apprehended and not apprehended,üîΩthen it is not tenable that it is past.üîΩIf you think that it is neither apprehended nor not apprehended,üîΩthen it is not tenable that it is past.

original: khas blangs nas kyang brjod pa ni /
analyzed: khas blangs nas kyang brjod pa ni /
translated: If you think that it is apprehended,üîΩthen it is not tenable that it is past.üîΩIf you think that it is not apprehended,

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba gzung ba'i don no //
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba gzung ba'i don no //
translated: The meaning of the term ‚Äúgrasped‚Äù is that which is to be appropriated.üîΩ

original: gal te 'byung bar 'gyur na zhes bya ba'i don /
analyzed: gal te 'byung bar 'gyur na zhes bya ba'i don /
translated: The meaning of the phrase ‚Äúif it were to occur‚Äù is that it would be apprehended.

original: gal te'i don the tshom za ba nyid du gyur pa ni /
analyzed: gal te'i don the tshom za ba nyid du gyur pa ni /
translated: If the meaning of ‚Äúif‚Äù were to be taken as doubt,

original: ma bzung bar nyid kyis khyab na ci ltar ma bzung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ma bzung bar nyid kyis khyab na ci ltar ma bzung bar 'gyur /
translated: then it would follow, absurdly, that it would not be apprehended.

original: bzung ba la ni the tshom du @185b gyur ba nyid 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bzung ba la ni the tshom du @185b gyur ba nyid 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: Doubt does not arise in regard to what is apprehended,

original: bzur ba nyid ma bzung ba dang 'gal bas na des khyab pa'i the tshom du gyur pa dang yang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzur ba nyid ma bzung ba dang 'gal bas na des khyab pa'i the tshom du gyur pa dang yang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the very fact that it is apprehended is incompatible with not being apprehended, and thus it is incompatible with doubt, which is pervaded by not being apprehended.

original: 'di nyid brjod pa ni the tshom dang ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid brjod pa ni the tshom dang ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is being said: ‚ÄúDoubt does not arise in regard to what is apprehended.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir bzung ba nyid yin na ni the tshom du gyur pa nyid 'jug par mi 'gyur pa zhig na /
analyzed: de'i phyir bzung ba nyid yin na ni the tshom du gyur pa nyid 'jug par mi 'gyur pa zhig na /
translated: Therefore, if it were apprehended, doubt would not arise.

original: 'jug pa yang yin te /
analyzed: 'jug pa yang yin te /
translated: But it does arise.

original: des nam bzung ngo zhes bya ba ni bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: des nam bzung ngo zhes bya ba ni bzlog pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit would not be apprehended‚Äù is a reversal.

original: 'on te 'byung bar 'gyur ba la gal te'i don 'jug kyang mi 'gal lo zhen gal te zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'on te 'byung bar 'gyur ba la gal te'i don 'jug kyang mi 'gal lo zhen gal te zhes bya ba ste /
translated: If the meaning of ‚Äúif‚Äù is taken to be ‚Äúif it were to occur,‚Äù then there is no contradiction.

original: gal te yod par 'gyur na de'i tshe bzung bar 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: gal te yod par 'gyur na de'i tshe bzung bar 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: If it existed, it would be apprehended.
